channel.title: Giant Bomb Audio Only Podcast Archive
channel.description: Giant Bomb is a website about video games founded by Jeff Gerstmann and Ryan Davis in 2008.

image.title: Giant Bomb Audio Only Podcast Archive

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 08/21/2014 - Diablo III: Ultimate Evil Edition
item.description: It's not a new game, but it's new to PS4 and Xbox One. Diablo III is pretty cool on consoles, and Jeff Gerstmann is here to tell you more about it.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/09/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Destiny is here and it's time to talk about it. Once we've gone over our first few hours with Bungie's latest, stick around for further discussion of Drew's introduction to local wrestling, Dan's recipe for bathtub chicken, and the popularity of Giant Bom

item.title: Alt+F1: 24 - 09/09/2014 - Italian Entanglement
item.description: Cars raced this weekend on F1's most hallowed ground, so naturally we're discussing ice cream Pokemon, sick menu music, how Rosberg is like Han Solo, and Formula E's British robot commentator.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/09/2014
item.description: Destiny is here and it's time to talk about it. Once we've gone over our first few hours with Bungie's latest, stick around for further discussion of Drew's introduction to local wrestling, Dan's recipe for bathtub chicken, and the popularity of Giant Bom

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Couples Who Broforce Together, Stay Together
item.description: Broforce developers Duncan and Shaz Greenwood traveled to PAX to show off their early access game. We chat about working on games with your significant other, figuring out what exactly is Broforce 1.0, and more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Punishing Philosophy of Titan Souls
item.description: Titan Souls designer Mark Foster explains how his project started as a demake of Shadow of the Colossus, and why players and bosses having one-hit deaths is so important.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: PAX Panel: We’ve Survived the Internet, And So Can You
item.description: Cards Against Humanity's Trin Garritano, Sentris developer Samantha Kalman, and Treachery in Beatdown City designer Shawn Allen joined me at PAX Prime to share stories about how to be a good person on the Internet. This feels...appropriate.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/05/2014
item.description: It's been a hell of a week. Can you help us, Diablo III and Gods Will Be Watching?

item.title: 8-4 Play: 09/5/2014 -- "One on None"
item.description: Hop on the Tokyo Game Show Hype (Bullet) Train with talk of Nintendo's New 3DS, Sony's Pre-TGS Press Conference, and Microsoft's Japan Xbox One launch, plus more thoughts on Gunvolt, Dark Souls II DLC, Final Fantasy XIV, Disgaea 4, and more!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: This Developer Has Already Used Gear VR
item.description: Darknet is a cyberpunk-influenced VR puzzle game that's been in development for over a year. Designer E McNeill has been messing with Samsung's Gear VR device for months, and spoke with us about VR's transition to mobile.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-07-2009
item.description: A slow-ass news week leads to discussions of open-world fatigue, Brad's honorable ancestry, Tales of Monkey Island, 1 vs. 100, Asteroids: The Movie, a sequel to Super Mario Bros. 2, and air horns. So very, very many air horns.

item.title: Alt+F1: 23 - 09/03/2014 - My Name Is Juan Pablo Montoya
item.description: Before Monza, we get down to car business and discuss Haas's engine pick, the cult of Maldonado, the reality of seagulls, and one possible explanation for the Verstappen incident.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/02/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Join us as we mop up the last little bit of PAX Prime business before moving on to more pressing discussions about eating bugs, Sony's TGS news, Frasier Pinball, the marvels of food science, and how to survive the apocalypse.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/02/2014
item.description: Join us as we mop up the last little bit of PAX Prime business before moving on to more pressing discussions about eating bugs, Sony's TGS news, Frasier Pinball, the marvels of food science, and how to survive the apocalypse.

item.title: Alt+F1: 22 - 08/27/2014 - Bruised Egos in Belgium
item.description: We anger the Romulans with more Pastor troubles, lenient Ferrari penalties, Vettel's driving face, a lack of baked beans, and perhaps the most disgusting and ingenious innovation racing has ever seen.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/26/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Not even the earth shaking beneath our feet can stop us from talking about bad Mario Kart tournaments, Infamous: First Light, the feasibility of Star Citizen, the Amazon/Twitch deal, Smash Bros. leaks, and another of Dan's awful, awful stories.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/26/2014
item.description: Not even the earth shaking beneath our feet can stop us from talking about bad Mario Kart tournaments, Infamous: First Light, the feasibility of Star Citizen, the Amazon/Twitch deal, Smash Bros. leaks, and another of Dan's awful, awful stories.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/25/2014
item.description: If you're looking for long tangents on Super Mario 64 and Richard Attenborough, you've come to the right place.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Goes to SummerSlam 2014
item.description: The Powerbombcast crew descends on the second-hottest pro-wrestling event of the summer (we couldn't get out to the G1 Climax, sadly), and comes away with more than a few stories to tell about random wrestler encounters, the state of WWE 2K15, and the dec

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-30-2009
item.description: What do Chris Cashman, Starcraft rap songs, Fallout/Doom crossovers, the fury of the BioWare doctors, different approaches to motion controls, and the future of Midway all have in common? Listen to this week's Giant Bombcast to find out!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/22/2014
item.description: After a trying week in the video game industry, we try to keep our heads up by digging into the new Madden, putting Divinity: Original Sin to rest, and sorting through the week's news.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 08/22/2014 -- "C+/B-"
item.description: Hyrule Warriors, P.T., Azure Striker Gunvolt, more Dark Souls II DLC, Gamescom press conferences, the Night Trap Kickstarter, Monster Hunter’s 10th Anniversary expo, and more!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Oakland Just Recently Made Pinball Legal
item.description: International Flipper Pinball Association president Josh Sharpe speaks with me about some crazy news from Oakland, California, and the state of pinball in 2014.

item.title: Alt+F1: 21 - 08/20/2014 - Racecars Return
item.description: Grab yourself a bag of delicious Frankenchomps, because F1 is back, baby! And so are we, with discussions of driver changes, penis museums, German country bands, and Bernie beating a bribery charge with a bribe.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Why One School Is Giving Out League of Legends Scholarships
item.description: As competitive games become more popular, Chicago's Robert Morris University wants to attract the young talent dumping hundreds of hours into them.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/19/2014
item.description: With Dan out at SummerSlam, Matt Rorie joins us to... have a lengthy conversation about professional wrestling, not to mention discussions of platform exclusivity, the Gamescom meat grinder, John Romero's return to shooters, and how to protect your virtua

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Alexa Ray Corriea: 08/18/2014
item.description: With Alex out, we indulgently geek out over P.T. and the Silent Hill series, before questioning the ethics of cheating in games. You don't need a walkthrough for this show!

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 11 - REGARDLESS OF VAMPIRISM
item.description: It's just about SummerSlam time, but before Alex, Dan, and Giancarlo take off to see the show (and WWE 2K15), Jeff joins them to run down the card, mull over the WWE Network's subscriber problem, talk a whole lot about the WWE's checkered history with rac

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/15/2014
item.description: We apologize in advance for the terrible puns in today's show. It's Germany's fault.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 08/14/2014 - Gamescom 2014
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann checks in with a bit of news out of Germany's annual gaming trade show.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-23-2009
item.description: We chop it up with Dave on the topics of Martian gorillas, necklaceness versus necklessness, Bobby Brown, modded Tiger Woods controllers, more Natal nonsense, Activision's grisly corporate ladder, among others. Caution: HOT!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 08/07/2014 - Velvet Sundown
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann gets into character and tells you all about Velvet Sundown, a proper role-playing game.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/31/2014 - EA Access
item.description: Are you willing to pay EA a subscription fee to play older games and get limited early access to its upcoming games?

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/24/2014 - Destiny Beta
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is ready to check in on Bungie's latest release as the beta for Destiny begins.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: A Sobering Conversation About Mobile Gaming
item.description: While making The Room, Fireproof learned how toxic the mobile world has become. Porting the game to PC gave it a chance to look back on that journey, and it's not pretty.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/12/2014
item.description: Jeff is back in the office...just long enough to tell us about his budding career as a pro Blitzball player. Brad played games other than Dota. Drew did battle in Golden Gate Park. Dan's been hanging out with the riff raff again. All this, plus your scari

item.title: Box Office Bomb: Episode 13 (Premium)
item.description: Alex and Rorie discuss Guardians of the Galaxy (mild spoilers, ends around half an hour in) and assorted other summer "blockbusters!" This was recorded before the untimely death of Robin Williams, but we'll take this opportunity to send our condolences to

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/11/2014
item.description: We curse our Google overlords, mull Diablo III on PS4, and wonder what the hell the head of Crytek is thinking right now.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/08/2014
item.description: We contemplate whether Twitch has gone and ruined everything this week. Oh, and beer.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 08/8/2014 -- "Party of V"
item.description: Dark Souls 2 DLC, The Legend of Heroes: TITS, Final Fantasy V, Final Fantasy X, Resident Evil Remake Remake, Twitch.tv content id-gate, Iwata Drama (tm), EA Access, PlayStation Now and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-16-2009
item.description: Jeff has conflicted feelings towards Vince Vaughn, Vinny loses sleep to Trash Panic, Brad gets incensed at this week's DSiWare offerings, and Ryan recovers from too much weekend fun in this week's episode of your favorite in-flight shopping magazine.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/05/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Newly minted Sony company man John T. Drake has completed his cross-country trek just in time to discuss the mystery of Matt Kessler, the riddle of Dan Ryckert, the curse of historic Barkerville, and the dilemma of Dwayne Johnson.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/05/2014
item.description: Newly minted Sony company man John T. Drake has completed his cross-country trek just in time to discuss the mystery of Matt Kessler, the riddle of Dan Ryckert, the curse of historic Barkerville, and the dilemma of Dwayne Johnson.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/04/2014
item.description: Alex returns to The Last of Us, while I wonder if my recent exploits in Divinity might qualify as cheating.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 08/01/2014
item.description: We reminisce about the glory days of b-movies before a lengthy discussion of Crypt of the NecroDancer, EA Access, and more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-09-2009
item.description: We try to keep things brief as we collect our thoughts on E3 2009 and discuss Jack Tretton's affinity for steaks, stock E3 conversations, spider ants, gun scorpions, the power of sequels, and what we're playing now that the show's over.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07/29/2014
item.description: We're live from the great state of Silicon Valley, USA with a hot list of summer tips to keep your water usage cool and conservational! Then you can beat the heat with the latest on Firefall, Destiny, Velvet Sundown, The Last of Us Remastered, and the end

item.title: Alt+F1: 20 - 07/29/2014 - Holy Hungary
item.description: The Hungarian sky opens just for a moment and rains down upon us one of the most entertaining races of the season. Crashes, derring-do, Pastor Maldonado; this one has it all!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 07/28/2014
item.description: While I try to figure out what's up with Kim Kardashian: Hollywood, Alex can't stop thinking about Mad Max. Seems fair.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 07/25/2014
item.description: Alex becomes concerned about Walking Dead's second season, but not before he disappears from the show for nearly 30 minutes. Don't worry, I've got this.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 07/25/2014 -- "A Rose By Any Other Name"
item.description: FRB Japan’s Scott Popular joins us to talk about Evo 2014, the Destiny beta, Xenoblade Chronicles, Yo-Kai Watch (of course), The International 4, Kim Kardashian, aDanza, Sega Genesis music, plot holes in Double Dragon, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/17/2014 - Q*Bert Rebooted
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann takes this opportunity to hop off the pyramid and shout $!#&$@!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07/22/2014
item.description: Brad's fresh off a plane from The International 4 to talk about rare couriers! Oh, and also Dota 2. Drew is a Ghostship Snowpiercer. Jeff plays too much bingo. Dan Ryckert doesn't know how to cook. Plus your incredible edible emails!

item.title: Alt+F1: 19 - 07/22/2014 - German Juvenility
item.description: With the German GP over and the Hungarian one upon us, we barely have time to wonder how to grill an entire cow, what Prince Charles' favorite fast food is, and whether Hamilton's radio guy is just messing with him.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2009 Day Three
item.description: We close out the show with special guests from Pandemic Studios and Mythic Entertainment.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 07/21/2014
item.description: Alex dives into the Destiny beta and comes out feeling pretty mixed, while I've fallen in love neverending burning hellscapes, aka Divinity: Original Sin.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 10 - Where it All Begins Again, and Again, and Again...
item.description: After too many weeks away, the Powerbombcast crew returns to remind ourselves of what went down at Money in the Bank, predict the outcomes of Battleground, and reminisce over what WrestleMania looked like a decade ago.

item.title: Alt+F1: 18 - 07/18/2014 - FRIC Frack
item.description: While the F1 field is contending with midseason rule changes and a dwindling supply of engines, Drew weighs the value of octagonal paper and chicken grenades, and Danny teaches us that good things CAN happen when you hop into a stranger's van.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 07/18/2014
item.description: In which we learn DOTA has infested ESPN, reveal secrets about my DDR past, and discuss Olli Olli, Divinity: Original Sin, and the week's news.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/10/2014 - Retron5
item.description: One device that can play NES, SNES, Genesis, Game Boy, and Game Boy Advance games? Jeff Gerstmann quickly talks about the Retron 5.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/03/2014 - Sniper Elite III
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's not a fan of sniping in most shooters, but this game built around long distance shooting gets a few things really right.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/26/2014 - EA Sports UFC
item.description: The more time Jeff Gerstmann spends with EA's UFC game, the less he likes it.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/19/2014 - Battlefield: Hardline
item.description: EA's shooter series is going all cops and robbers on us this year. Jeff Gerstmann got an early look at the game's multiplayer.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/12/2014 - Halo: The Master Chief Collection
item.description: Microsoft is packing four Halo games into one package for the Xbox One, and Jeff Gerstmann is here with some details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/05/2014 - Mortal Kombat X
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann wasn't sure if it was "ten" or "ecks" at the time, but apparently the new Mortal Kombat is Mortal Kombat "ecks." Also it's the tenth one. Crazy!

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2009 Day Two
item.description: We're not gonna lie: guests from Capcom, GRIN, Gamasutra, and Jellyvision make this hands-down the craziest Bombcast ever.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/29/2014 - Watch Dogs
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann has done his share of cell phone hacking on the streets of Chicago, and he's here to let you know that it isn't as fun as that might sound.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/22/2014 - Evolve
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's opinion on 2K's upcoming four-on-one multiplayer monster shooter is, shall we say, evolving? No? We shouldn't say that? OK, got it.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/15/2014 - Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.description: Call of Duty is, of course, back for another year. Will it help reestablish this slowly-sliding franchise? Jeff Gerstmann has the first details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/08/2014 - The Amazing Spider-Man 2
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's never been the most dedicated web-slinger, but he's seen enough to know that Amazing Spider-Man 2 probably isn't worth your time.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/01/2014 - Disney Infinity: Marvel Super Heroes
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is present, accounted for, and ready to tell you about the future of Disney's "toys that work with video games" sequel, which brings Marvel and Disney characters together.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07/15/2014
item.description: Sentris developer Samantha Kalman drops by to chat with us about GaymerX2, the value of programming, the Nintendo 64's forgotten lineup, electronic sports, the secret identity of Freezyfrog, microbial science, and Dan Ryckert's odd, odd palate.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Danielle Riendeau: 07/14/2014
item.description: With Alex on jury duty, Polygon's Danielle Riendeau joins me to chat about this weekend's GaymerX event, Valiant Hearts, Divinity: Original Sin, and more.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 07/11/2014 -- "MOBA-Tah Blues"
item.description: Yo-kai Watch 2, Super House of Dead Ninjas, Japanese baths, Dragon Quest X for 3DS, John’s free-to-play addiction, preorder DLC, 3DS update speculation, EVO 2014 hyyyype!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 07/11/2014
item.description: We contemplate the meaning of existence as told through a mountain, reflect on a full season of The Wolf Among Us, talk about Alien: Isolation and pre-order DLC, and something about LeBron James.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Video Games: The Movie: The Interview
item.description: Jeremy Snead, director of the documentary Video Games: The Movie, speaks with us about getting the chance to cover the history of his favorite medium.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2009 Day One
item.description: We're joined by Obsidian's Matthew Rorie as we discuss the Nintendo and Sony press conferences, much of Activision's offerings, Mass Effect 2, Left 4 Dead 2, Supreme Commander 2, and more!

item.title: Alt+F1: 17 - 07/09/2014 - The Battle of Britain
item.description: This past weekend was a difficult one for race cars. If they weren't exploding during practice or getting doused in qualifying, they were having tires hurled at them, walls crashed into them, and other cars trying to flip them over. Blimey!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07/08/2014
item.description: July rages on with discussion of important games like horseshoes. Also we discuss Cliff Blezinski's new operation, Gearbox's new hobby-grade meta-growth video gaming product, Destiny's ninety different versions, Mighty No. 9's hat-passing techniques, and

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 07/07/2014
item.description: We fall into a black hole of AOL and CompuServe before finding our way out via Net Zero.

item.title: Alt+F1: 16 - 07/02/2014 - Smithereens Galore
item.description: The Battle of Britain is about to reconvene! Meanwhile, we're talkin' about practice, new rules, Danny's fear of air shows, and the future of mankind as a species.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07/01/2014
item.description: Brad returns from vacation to discuss his handheld travel adventures while Jeff and Drew wax poetic about the news of the week, shooting Nazis in their privates, buying Japanese PSN games, and your emails. This week: Why can't Jeff stop playing Marvel Her

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: A Conversation With Wolfenstein: The New Order's Jens Matthies
item.description: The creative director for one of 2014's most surprising games talks about how MachineGames made Wolfenstein relevant in the modern age.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 06/30/2014
item.description: We mull Snowpiercer and The Leftovers before talking about Shovel Knight, Watch Dogs, and the ethics of selling early access games at retail.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 06/27/2014
item.description: We wonder about the future of dogs in Valiant Hearts, admire the jumping of Shovel Knight, and try to wrap up a show before a doctor appointment.

item.title: Giant Bombcast MicroCast @Activision 06-02-2009
item.description: Jeff and Ryan give a quick update from the Activision booth.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 06/27/2014 -- "Can You Even Have a Baby?!"
item.description: Superagent Ben Judd joins the crew to recap what we learned from E3, dig deep into Shovel Knight, the Destiny Alpha, Summer Games Done Quick, balloon swords, Evo 2014, and more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: A Song for Viggo Explores a Parent's Worst Nightmare
item.description: The Kickstarter project has just a few days to go, but designer Simon Karlsson finds time to chat about the reason he wants to tell the story about a father who accidentally runs over his son. Yes, you read that right.

item.title: Alt+F1: 15 - 06/25/2014 - Austrian Absolution
item.description: A (reasonably) healthy Danny joins Drew to discuss Soviet industrial design, the positive effects of Four Loko, science ovens, and which button to NEVER EVER PUSH.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06/24/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Drew and Jeff are joined by a pair of guests as we discuss table flipping arcade games, the mysterious appearance of Vince, EA's UFC, Primal Rage 2, floppy disk versions of Strider, and "football."

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06/24/2014
item.description: Drew and Jeff are joined by a pair of guests as we discuss table flipping arcade games, the mysterious appearance of Vince, EA's UFC, Primal Rage 2, floppy disk versions of Strider, and "football."

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Alexa Ray Corriea: 06/23/2014
item.description: Come for the talk about Shovel Knight, Mario Kart, and Watch Dogs, stay for the descent into madness over Sonic the Hedgehog and Tetsuya Nomura.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Meet the Man Behind Games Done Quick
item.description: One of the most popular charity speedrunning events is getting ready to kick off its summer event on Sunday. We caught up with organizer (and speedrunner!) Andrew Schroeder to learn how such an event is put together.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 06/20/2014
item.description: E3 2014 has come and gone. The world has changed. It's all about dogs now. You know, dogs, the Destiny alpha, concerns about No Man's Sky, and more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: No Metroid? No Problem, We've Got Axiom Verge
item.description: Tom Happ is developing the heavily Metroid-inspired Axiom Verge all by himself. It looks absolutely amazing, and tried to learn a bit more about it at E3 this year.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06/17/2014
item.description: E3 2014 has come and gone, and we're left to pick up the pieces with further ruminations on No Man's Sky, Battlefield Hardline, Far Cry 4, and Destiny, along with Drew's weekend combat experience, Danny's Irish plague, Rorie's E3 at home, and the one emai

item.title: Giant Bombcast MicroCast 06-02-2009
item.description: Jeff and Ryan discuss what they think they know about Nintendo's upcoming press conference.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-29-2008
item.description: Jeff and Ryan fight a losing battle against sleep depravation in this very special, very felonious, very short episode of the Giant Bombcast.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Adam Orth Is Adrift
item.description: The former Microsoft employee is channeling his recent experiences into a VR-enhanced space adventure called Adrift. We briefly caught up with Orth at E3.

item.title: E3 2014: Day Three LIVE! (Premium)
item.description: We close out the show with our impressions and a lineup of guests that includes Ed Boon, Zoe Quinn, Geoff Keighley, Alexa Ray Corriea, Josh Sawyer, Abbie Heppe, Rami Ismail, Paul Barnett, and more!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 06/13/2014 -- "E3 2014 Supercast"
item.description: John Davison, Garnett Lee, and Mike McWhertor — plus a surprise blast of bonus guests! — join Mark and John from LA to talk anything and everything E3, including Smash Bros, Destiny, Zelda, Bloodborne, Splatoon, and plenty more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2014: Day Three LIVE!
item.description: We close out the show with our impressions and a lineup of guests that includes Ed Boon, Zoe Quinn, Geoff Keighley, Alexa Ray Corriea, Josh Sawyer, Abbie Heppe, Rami Ismail, Paul Barnett, and more!

item.title: E3 2014: Day Two LIVE! (Premium)
item.description: We're joined by Some Brothers McElroy, Cara Ellison, Casey Lynch, Mikey Neumann, Beef O'Brady, Seth Killian, Wes Phillips, Jeremy Hoffman, Chris Charla, Mike Mika, Dennis Wedin, Nathan Vella, Kris Piotrowski, Greg Rice, Rayme Vinson, Abbie Heppe, and more

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2014: Day Two LIVE!
item.description: We're joined by Some Brothers McElroy, Cara Ellison, Casey Lynch, Mikey Neumann, Beef O'Brady, Seth Killian, Wes Phillips, Jeremy Hoffman, Chris Charla, Mike Mika, Dennis Wedin, Nathan Vella, Kris Piotrowski, Greg Rice, Rayme Vinson, Abbie Heppe, and more

item.title: E3 2014: Day One LIVE! (Premium)
item.description: We're joined by Palmer Luckey, Shuhei Yoshida, Phil Spencer, Dave Lang, Adam Boyes, Greg Kasavin, Sean Murray, John Mamais, and a host of additional luminaries as our first day of E3 2014 wraps up!

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2014: Day One LIVE!
item.description: We're joined by Palmer Luckey, Shuhei Yoshida, Phil Spencer, Dave Lang, Adam Boyes, Greg Kasavin, Sean Murray, John Mamais, and a host of additional luminaries as our first day of E3 2014 wraps up!

item.title: Alt+F1: 14 - 06/10/2014 - Canadian Curve Ball
item.description: Somewhere in the bowels of the LA Convention Center, Danny and Drew find a (relatively) quiet place to relive the craziest race in recent memory.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2014: Day Zero Wrap-Up!
item.description: The press conferences are over and we're wrapping up with friends from 8-4, Harmonix, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2009 Day Zero
item.description: We reflect on the Microsoft, Electronic Arts, and Ubisoft press conferences. Also, pizza!

item.title: E3 2014: Day Zero Wrap-Up! (Premium)
item.description: The press conferences are over and we're wrapping up with friends from 8-4, Harmonix, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06/10/2014: E3 Preview and Predictions!
item.description: We gather together the week before E3 to cover the games Jeff saw during his pre-show sojourn and make a bunch of very half-cocked predictions. Listen in to see just how wrong we were!

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 9 - Nothing Was Batista, and Everything Hurt
item.description: Alex, Jeff, Giancarlo, and Dan analyze the last five weeks' worth of professional wrestling and come to a startling conclusion: wrestling's kind of bad right now.

item.title: Box Office Bomb: Episode 12 (Premium)
item.description: Alex and Rorie sit down with some mild spoilers for Godzilla and X-Men: Days of Future past, talk about all these damn Marvel movies we got coming up and the directors they may or may not have, ponder on the raw badness of Riddick, and, of course, meditat

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 06/06/2014
item.description: The Wolf is having Internet problems, but that's not gonna stop me from pontificating about E3 for nearly an hour.

item.title: Alt+F1: 13 - 06/03/2014 - Poutine Slicks
item.description: Danny offends a nation, Drew offends anyone with a name, and that guy from The Beach brings us one step closer to either the futuristical racing league of our dreams, or the racing version of the XFL.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06/03/2014

item.title: Alt+F1: 12 - 05/27/2014 - Monte Carlo Melodrama
item.description: Danny and Drew make a good party in the podcast studio recounting Marussia magic, Maldonado mishaps, and Sherlock's stellar mic skills. Ears.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-29-2009

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Zoe Quinn Has Embraced Our Cybernetic Future
item.description: Unlike Adam Jensen, Zoe Quinn asked for this. She's had both a chip and a magnet implanted in her hand that allows her to feel magnetic fields and interact with NFC devices. It's...crazy. So we hopped on Skype to talk about it, and some ideas she has for

item.title: Alt+F1: 09 - 05/06/2014 - Google Machines

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05/06/2014

item.description: Jeff Gerstmann recognizes that this game isn't perfect, but he still wants to beat your Trials Fusion times.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 8 - Going for the Cheap Poop

item.description: Emanuel Maiberg wanted to know if getting an edge in Counter-Strike and other games was as easy as cheating websites make it out to be, so he went undercover to find out.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: A Museum Just Acquired 22 Pallets of Atari History
item.description: Video games are getting older, and institutions like The Strong are doing their best to preserve, archive, and exhibit its past.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-19-2009

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 04/25/2014

item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is surprised that this long-in-development South Park game came out at all, but it's even cooler that it's actually a successful South Park game.

item.description: Amazon's in the set-top box business with a streaming device that also plays a handful of Android games. But does that mean that Amazon is really getting in the video game business?

item.description: They've gone ahead and made an online Elder Scrolls game, but is that something that anyone actually wants? Jeff Gerstmann has some things to say about all this.

item.description: Jeff Gerstmann sneaks onto the base, finds some distressing things, and reports back after an hour or two.

item.description: Jeff Gerstmann takes a virtual trip to Seattle, where he somehow managed to get special powers and blow up a bunch of lame government thugs.

item.description: If I don't talk about Hearthstone, maybe I won't think about Hearthstone? Maybe we can talk about Trials Fusion and the week's news, instead.

item.title: Alt+F1: 06 - 04/15/2014 - Just Jorts

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04/15/2014 [Premium]

item.description: A trio of Giant Bomb compadres compare notes on PAX East 2014, Wrestlemania 2000, tank simulators, Trials Fusion, Snoop Dogg's latest release, Johnny Gat's latest cameo, drinking soda in front of a camera, and more stuff!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Devolver Digital Just Wants to Help
item.description: Co-founder Mike Wilson has been around the gaming block a few times: id Software, Ion Storm, Gathering of Developers. With Devolver Digital, he wants to empower developers by helping them only where they need it.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The State of Diversity in Games
item.description: BioWare gameplay designer Manveer Heir's talk at GDC this year was "Misogyny, Racism and Homophobia: Where Do Video Games Stand?" We spent a few minutes chatting about why he gave this topic a closer look.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Wait, SOMA Takes Place Underwater?
item.description: My interview with Amnesia designer Thomas Grip from last year was apparently full of lies. I went to San Francisco for some damn answers.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04/08/2014

item.description: We have a reasonable dialogue about people having a reasonable dialogue about Luftrausers' aesthetic. Alex talked about Wrestlemania? I dunno, I passed out.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 04/04/2014
item.description: We question whether Nintendo has finally turned a dark corner, ruminate over the lessons of Threes, and discuss the week's big news.

Maxi Boost, Boom Beach, Monument Valley, Facebook & Oculus, Phil Spencer & Xbox, Amazon Fire TV, Brave Wave music, and more!

item.title: Alt+F1: 04 - 04/01/2014 - Mutiny in Malaysia
item.description: DATELINE Malaysia: Ricciardo can't catch a break, a Finn blows a hole, and two teammates clash at 180 MPH.

item.description: The Legend of Zelda, Secret of Mana, and others are a huge part of what the team behind the ridiculously good looking (and playing!) Hyper Light Drifter is aiming for.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 03/25/2014
item.description: Things get a little misty as we catch up, embrace, and talk about Dark Souls 2, GDC, inFamous, and more.

item.description: Australia requires more sexy, Red Bull gives you appeals, Danny speaks a made-up language, and MORE in the run-up to Malaysia.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Why Majesco's Heading to Midnight City
item.description: The publisher you're surprised is still around hopes to help smaller developers make a bunch of cool stuff. You know, like Costume Quest 2. VP of publishing Casey Lynch laid out the company's vision to me this week at GDC.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Lorne Lanning Isn't Giving Up on Oddworld
item.description: A graphical overhaul of Oddworld: Abe's Odyssey is only the first step in the designer's big plans for the future of the beloved series. If people buy it, of course.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Surprising History of Frog Fractions
item.description: The only thing stranger than Frog Fractions itself is the story of how the game came to be, as told by developer Jim Crawford.

item.title: Alt+F1: 02 - 03/18/2014 - Melbourne Mayhem
item.description: Turn one crashes, major malfunctions, and accidental nose jobs prove what we always knew: Australia is NUTS!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-07-2009
item.description: With Brad out of the office, we invite gamecop Giancarlo Varanini to fill the fourth chair as we drink bird-nest-based beverages, recount Jeff and Vinny's nightmare weekend in Houston, appraise the initial DSiWare offerings, and more.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 02/21/2014
item.description: Let's spit fire about Strider, Freedom Cry, and NaissanceE before trying to get Alex to say something about Thief.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 02/21/2014 -- "I CHOOSE YOU, AAJST(????"
item.description: MGS translator Jeremy Blaustein and Sega's Ethan Einhorn join us for the Japanese PS4 launch to talk about their careers (Jaleco! Konami! Sega!), games we've been playing (Titanfall! Strider! Left Behind!), and all the news fit to...uh, recite (Twitch Pok

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 02/20/2014 - Twitch Plays Pokemon
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann returns to tell you that he can't stop watching tens of thousands of people attempting to play Pokemon Red at the same time.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 02/13/2014 - Titanfall Beta
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann took a trip to robot suit city last week, so let's catch up with some details on the upcoming Titanfall beta.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 02/06/2014 - Strider
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann checks out the early parts of Capcom's upcoming Strider reboot.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Ethics of Freedom Cry
item.description: Kotaku writer Evan Narcisse, whose parents were actually born in Haiti, joins me to discuss the moral, ethical, and emotional reactions we experienced playing Assassin's Creed IV: Freedom Cry. WARNING: Spoilers ahead.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Man Who Stares at Plants
item.description: Alex Swaim's interest in the technical side of video game art has prompted him to spend lots of time looking at the parts of virtual worlds we hardly ever think about.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02/18/2014 [PREMIUM]
item.description: Vinny leaves his home in search of information about the upcoming human/cyborg conflict while Jeff stays home to type "start" into a Twitch chat window over and over again. Drew flies a plane. Oh, and Brad Shoemaker rushes in to talk about that DLC for Th

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02/18/2014
item.description: Vinny leaves his home in search of information about the upcoming human/cyborg conflict while Jeff stays home to type "start" into a Twitch chat window over and over again. Drew flies a plane. Oh, and Brad Shoemaker rushes in to talk about that DLC for Th

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 02/14/2014
item.description: We wonder whether Titanfall can really hook us over the longterm, wish Republique was a better game, and stress over the upcoming slate of games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-31-2009
item.description: Ryan and Vinny fight a losing battle against the GDC fever as we address Jeff's Punch-Out!!-induced inner turmoil, Brad's excitement over the ill-named League of Legends: Clash of Fates, cloth maps, Don King, suave bananas, and more!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Giant Bomb Users Really, Really Like Dark Souls
item.description: I've already explained why I fell in love with Dark Souls, but part of the reason I started playing was because of Giant Bomb's users loving it so much. So I asked them why. Warning: This podcast begins with colorful language.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02/11/2014 [PREMIUM]
item.description: The podcast gang reforms to discuss Super Metroid. Oh, and also Bravely Default, more horrific workplace nudity, Dungeon Keeper (not that one, the other one), Jeff's trip to the DICE Summit, Titanfall on the Xbox 360, the business of arcade games in laund

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02/11/2014
item.description: The podcast gang reforms to discuss Super Metroid. Oh, and also Bravely Default, more horrific workplace nudity, Dungeon Keeper (not that one, the other one), Jeff's trip to the DICE Summit, Titanfall on the Xbox 360, the business of arcade games in laund

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Jim Sterling
item.description: Game critic, personality, and voice actor (?!) Jim Sterling joins us to talk YouTube, Flappy Bird, Jazzpunk, Steam, and more!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 02/07/2014 -- "Click Here to Rate Us 5 Stars"
item.description: With John working on his Flappy Bird score, Tokyo gaming expert Jean Snow and Johnny (ex) "Intern" Linnert join us to talk Outlast, Brothers, Broken Age, Tales of Xillia, Puppeteer, Sengoku Basara 4, Groove Coaster Arcade, Dark Souls, Nintendo's investors

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 02/07/2014
item.description: There aren't many times where we can talk about Airplane! on a video game show.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: How F2P Ruined Tales of Phantasia on iOS
item.description: Dungeon Keeper isn't the only game getting warped by new business models. Touch Arcade's writer Shaun Musgrave breaks down how the SNES JRPG has been "modified" for 2014.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02/04/2014
item.description: Will Smith and Dave Snider join us as we swap tales of games, space battles, and workplace nightmare scenarios. Everything a good woodworking podcast needs.

item.title: Giant Bombcast BioWare Edition
item.description: Ryan and Brad sit down with Ray Muzyka and Greg Zeschuk at GDC 09 to discuss both Dragon Age: Origins and BioWare's origins.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02/04/2014 [Premium]
item.description: Will Smith and Dave Snider join us as we swap tales of games, space battles, and workplace nightmare scenarios. Everything a good woodworking podcast needs.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Loser of EVE Online's Bloody B-R5RB Conflict
item.description: Manfred “Manny” Sideous is the player who wasn't able to pay a bill...and paid the price. His group, Pandemic Legion, was marching forward until disaster struck.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Winner of EVE Online's Bloody B-R5RB Conflict
item.description: Alex "The Mittani" Gianturco is one of EVE Online's most notorious players, the leader of Something Awful's Goonswarm Alliance. He was also victorious at B-R5RB.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Mike Bithell
item.description: Mike Bithell, the creator of Thomas Was Alone and the upcoming stealther Volume, joins us to chat about developing games, the nature of sales, and BAAAAATMAAAAN.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 01/31/2014
item.description: The happiness overflows with Octodad, while the darkness overwhelms with The Banner Saga. Oh, and Nintendo has some plans for the future.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 01/30/2014 - Gears of War
item.description: Microsoft is getting back into the chainsawgun business and Jeff Gerstmann has a few things to say about it.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: It's a Dark Souls II Interview
item.description: Bandai Namco's Brian Hong tells us whatever it is he knows about the new RPG from From.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/28/2014 [Premium]
item.description: Vinny practices The Castle Doctrine while Jeff makes a serious attempt to become a Strider. Meanwhile, Drew gets into something wild while Brad continues to suffer from a crippling MOBA addiction. Also, we talk Nintendo, getting "Genesis big," Las Vegas,

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/28/2014
item.description: Vinny practices The Castle Doctrine while Jeff makes a serious attempt to become a Strider. Meanwhile, Drew gets into something wild while Brad continues to suffer from a crippling MOBA addiction. Also, we talk Nintendo, getting "Genesis big," Las Vegas,

item.title: [Premium] Box Office Bomb: Episode 10
item.description: It returns! We discuss the Oscar prospects of a bunch of movies we've never seen, Alex reports in on his batch of Chinese plane movies, True Detective is pretty darn good, and it's time for the Razzies as well!

item.title: Giant Bombcast GDC 09 Day Two
item.description: Day two sees Harmonix's own Alex Navarro, John Drake, and Sean Baptiste, Tigon Studios' Ian Stevens, and Pandemic's Drew Marlowe join the fray.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Jenn Frank
item.description: Game critic Jenn Frank, the voice in Super Hexagon, joins us to chat The Castle Doctrine's morality and analyze Nicolas Cage's career.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 1/24/2014 -- "CANDY has a CRUSH on SAGA"
item.description: Hours have passed since the occupation of 8-4 Towers by one Alexander O. Smith, founder of the Kajiya sect. Tune in for talk of localization feats (Vagrant Story! Tactics Ogre! FFXII!) as well as his Kickstarter, Unsung Story, and thoughts on Don’t Star

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 01/24/2014
item.description: We try to figure out which half of Broken Age we like, solve all of Nintendo's problems, and pretend to understand trademark law.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 5: Animal Kingdom
item.description: On this first Powerbombcast of the new year, the whole gang gets back together to talk Royal Rumble predictions, the debatable value of Batista's return, watching New Japan Pro Wrestling into the wee hours, and what the WWE Network means for our collectiv

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 01/23/2014 - Broken Age
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann clicks on a tape deck, then clicks on a tape, then clicks on the tape deck again, then this minute of audio about Broken Age started playing. Weird.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 01/16/2014 - The New Rise of Local Multiplayer
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann likes the internet, but this new batch of competitive local multiplayer games is providing some pretty solid reasons to stay offline.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Slippery Slope of Video Game Sales
item.description: Passage and The Castle Doctrine designer Jason Rohrer believes our newfound culture of video game sales is hurting players and developers at the same time.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 01/09/2014 - Oculus Rift Update
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann checks in with the latest updates on Oculus' ambitious plans to bring virtual reality into your home.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/21/2014 [PREMIUM]
item.description: Giant Bomb checks in this week with timely coverage of Dark Souls, Broken Age, OlliOlli, Beyond 2000, cataloguing your classics, how to kill the teens of Maniac Mansion, and the precise number of Atari 2600s a person should own.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/21/2014
item.description: Giant Bomb checks in this week with timely coverage of Dark Souls, Broken Age, OlliOlli, Beyond 2000, cataloguing your classics, how to kill the teens of Maniac Mansion, and the precise number of Atari 2600s a person should own.

item.title: Giant Bombcast GDC 09 Day One
item.description: We discuss some of the highlights from our first day at GDC 09 with an all-star panel of game developers, including EALA's Amer Ajami and Greg Kasavin, Mythic Entertainment's Paul Barnett, 2K Boston's Joe Fielder, and Turn 10 Studios' Che Chou.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Zoe Quinn
item.description: The designer behind Depression Quest, which recently went through Greenlight, joins us to kick off the week.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 01/17/2014
item.description: Dark Souls is taking its toll. The Banner Saga is full of death. Nintendo isn't doing well. It's a really positive episode.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Giant Bomb's Readers Predict 2014
item.description: It is no longer the year of Luigi. We're lost. So we asked some "experts" for help.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/14/2014
item.description: The health experts at Giant Bomb finally wade into the flu vaccine debate, then we discuss the deeper nuances of Action Biker for the Commodore 64, some of this Dota 2 business, and end up talking about Ryu's magical/not-magical abilities some more.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 01/13/2014
item.description: Alex's world tour is over, and Giant Bomb has the exclusive interview.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 01/10/2014
item.description: I Get This Call Every Day's designer join us to talk about the struggles of being a full-time designer...and Majora's Mask. Download

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 12/30/2013 - Some 2014 Predictions
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann gazes into his crystal ball... and makes some of the most non-prediction predictions possible about the future of Fallout and Mortal Kombat.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 12/26/2013 - Ultra Street Fighter IV
item.description: With another add-on to Street Fighter IV on the way, Jeff Gerstmann just wants to know if he can be the first to say "does Capcom even know how to count to five?!?!?!"

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 12/19/2013 - Battlefield 4
item.description: It's been broken in some fairly major ways, but when (if?) Battlefield 4 ever comes together, Jeff Gerstmann thinks it'll probably be pretty great.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-24-2009
item.description: It's a death march of weird accents and terrifying candy as we're joined by Ulf Andersson and Gunnar Johansson from GRIN. We also discuss OnLive, Max Payne 3, BioShock 2 subtitle shenanigans, and much more in this epic edition of the Giant Bombcast.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 01/10/2014 -- "Holiday Hangover"
item.description: John’s out sick, but the show must go on! This week we talk about how we spent our New Years, Ys II, Bravely Default, Zelda: ALBW, Mark’s Gamestop experience, what Hiroko *wants* to play, CES, pizza and more!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: One Month With a Steam Machine
item.description: Christopher Kinniburgh was one of 300 people chosen to receive a Steam Machine from Valve. We chatted about how he was picked, and what it's been like to live in the future.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Why Silicon Knights Vs. Epic Games Is Probably Over
item.description: The latest court ruling was handed down earlier this week, and Law 360 reporter Michael Lipkin's here to explain why it's likely the end of the road.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: This Fitness Developer's Secret Sauce Is Story
item.description: Zombies, Run! and The Walk have been big successes for Six to Start, even as some in the fitness world are still scratching their heads.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/07/2014 [PREMIUM]
item.description: It's CES week, so you know that means it's time to talk televisions! Get down and dirty with our resolution resolutions for 2014... or should we say 2014K????? Because 4K televisions, you know? Anyway, video games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01/07/2014
item.description: It's CES week, so you know that means it's time to talk televisions! Get down and dirty with our resolution resolutions for 2014... or should we say 2014K????? Because 4K televisions, you know? Anyway, video games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12/31/2013
item.description: This episode of the Giant Bombcast was filmed live in front of a webcam audience. The audio is pretty rough for the first five minutes, then it gets better. But it's still not as good as it sounds when we're in a studio, because we weren't in a studio. Th

item.title: 8-4 Play: 12/28/2013 -- "Because the eShop"
item.description: 8-4 alumni Andy Church and Brendon Pritchard come home for the holidays to tell us all about their latest MMO adventures in Final Fantasy XIV and Dragon Quest X Version 2, but not before we talk about Zelda: ALBW (again), Puzzle & Dragons Z, Bravely D

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 12/20/2013
item.description: We close out 2013 with extensive talk about Assassin's Creed IV: Freedom Cry, diversity, and long sighs about...The Hobbit.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Paul Barnett's Top 10 Gaming Moments of 2013
item.description: Mythic Entertainment GM Paul Barnett can't be bothered to listen to things like "rules," so instead of 10 games, he's got 10 moments. And instead of a text list, he came into San Francisco to sit down and chat.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-17-2009
item.description: The Bombcast gets frappadocious this week with discussions of MadWorld's racial insensitivity, the douche-reduced Army of Two sequel, Criterion's April Fools prank, plus an inordinate amount of GI Joe talk. Once a man!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Paul Barnett's Golden Rule
item.description: Mythic Entertainment General Manager Paul Barnett swings by to talk to Jeff Gerstmann about his concept of a "golden era," what it means to run a studio, why you'll probably never see a new Road Rash, and the weird, almost-exclusively British love of Para

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2013: Day Five
item.description: The final day is upon us, so sit down and get angry as we determine Giant Bomb's Best Horror Game, "Please Stop," Worst Game, and Best Game. Best game!

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2013: Day Four
item.description: Day four is here and it's time to talk about 2013's Hottest Mess, Best Moment or Sequence, Best Use of a Licensed Song, and the Biggest News.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2013: Day Three
item.description: Strap in and prepare yourself as we get set to debate Best Exclusive Launch Game, Apology of the Year, Best Trend, and Best Debut.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2013: Day Two
item.description: Giant Bomb's deliberations continue as we determine the winners of Best Story, Best Music, Most Disappointing Game, and Best New Character.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2013: Day One
item.description: We convene to determine the winners of 2013’s Old Game of the Year, URL of the Year, Best Surprise, and Best-Looking Game as this year's Game of the Year presentation commences!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Smithsonian Embraces Video Games
item.description: Flower and Halo 2600 (?!) have entered the museum's permanent collection. Film and media art curator Michael Mansfield explains how the museum picked these games, and explains why the time is now for the medium.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12/17/2013
item.description: We close out the year in "typical" podcasting with one that's loaded up solid with your emails.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Totalbiscuit
item.description: John "Totalbiscuit" Bain joins us to talk copyright, Call of Juarez, Wonderful 101, game of the year, and more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-10-2009
item.description: With Ryan back in the saddle, the Giant Bombcast returns from the brink with delicious Mexican vanilla soda, the quieter side of Sgt. Slaughter, extensive and unnecessary Ghostbusters references, the winners of our Noby Noby Boy contest, and much more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-15-2008
item.description: It’s Nintendo week on the Giant Bombcast as we discuss all the hot new games that were shown at last week’s media summit in San Francisco. We also discuss the return of Interplay, get angry at Wired and meddling marketers, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 12/12/2013 - Peggle 2
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann isn't a gambling man, but this bright, shiny pachinko-style game has given him a case of the shakes.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 12/05/2013 - Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann may not know what a "mizzen mast" is, but that hasn't really stopped him from enjoying the latest Assassin's Creed.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 12/13/13 -- "Take it to the Fridge"
item.description: Newcomer Roy Blakely joins the 8-4-some to talk (more) Mario, (more) Zelda, (more) Resogun, Ibb and Obb, Samurai Gunn, Bravely Default, Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 ReMIX, 3DS Miiverse, the VGX Awards, the life and times of Hideki Kamiya, and more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12/10/2013
item.description: The crew convenes just before beginning the long trek to determine Giant Bomb's Official and Binding Game of the Year for 2013 to talk about Peggle 2, Starbound, Doki-Doki Universe, and other such video games.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Thou Shalt Not Stream (The Competition)
item.description: Last week, Riot Games declared its paid players could not stream everything from DOTA 2 to...Fat Princess? It eventually backed down, and I called up OnGamers senior eSports editor Rod Breslau to learn more.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Cara Ellison
item.description: UK writer Cara Ellison joins us to chat Half-Life, Black Flag, The Novelist, Dead Rising 3, the VGXs, and the role of criticism. (Photo courtesy of Gary Dutton.)

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 12/06/2013
item.description: We grit our teeth and try to talk reasonably about microtransactions, and somehow WWF: No Mercy comes up.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Players You Don't Know About
item.description: FREEQ is an audio-focused radio drama set in the future, but it was never designed for players who couldn't see. Until they asked.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 4: Season's Beatings
item.description: Alex, Jeff, Giancarlo, and Dan discuss the WWE's muddied title lineages, mostly try to forget that Survivor Series ever happened, and discover just what kind of Pandora's Box is opened when Jeff actually watches an episode of TNA.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Who You Gonna Call? Edition
item.description: You're right, no human being would stack books like this. And the flowers are still standing! What about the Twinkie? Yes, have some. Dogs and cats, living together... mass hysteria! What did you do, Ray? I love this plan! I'm excited to be a part of it!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: How Typing of the Dead: Overkill Almost Never Lived
item.description: When a studio goes under, that's usually the end of it. But after Blitz Games imploded, the UK developers tasked with resurrecting Sega's quirky series didn't give up.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12/03/2013
item.description: "Eastside" Alex Navarro comes to town to discuss cold weather and trampolines, but the rest of us are on-hand to discuss video games! (Also, Thanksgiving.)

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Chronicling the Creation of Diablo
item.description: Author David Craddock is piecing together the history of Blizzard North and the Diablo series across three books, starting with Stay Awhile and Listen. We chat about the process of writing the book, and the best stories he heard.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 12/02/2013
item.description: Our love for Tearaway knows no bounds, but that's also true of Mario, Zelda, and Assassin's Creed. So many games!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 11/29/2013 -- "A Link Between 3D Worlds"
item.description: John and JJ are back! And talking Mario, Zelda, next-gen systems, Mario, Persona 5, microtransactions, Zelda, Resogun, Mario, and taking sides in the console wars. And stick around for a special bonus segment focus(attack)ing on the Ultra SF4 location tes

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Side of Cosplay You Don't Hear About
item.description: Most of us just look at photo galleries. But what motivates people to wear these elaborate costumes? With years of cosplay under her belt, writer and cosplayer Maddy Myers sheds light on this passionate craft.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/28/2013 - Killer Instinct
item.description: The long-dormant fighting series returns as an Xbox One launch game, but is it any good? Jeff Gerstmann's here with the details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/21/2013 - Xbox One Launches!
item.description: Hot on the heels of the PlayStation 4 is Microsoft's Xbox One, and Jeff Gerstmann has the info.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/14/2013 - PlayStation 4 Launches!
item.description: Sony's PlayStation 4 is about to hit store shelves and Jeff Gerstmann is here with the details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaminge Minute 11/07/2013 - Call of Duty: Ghosts
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann returns from the smoking hole in Southern California to tell you about Activision's latest shooter.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-03-2009
item.description: With Ryan out on vacation, we have no idea what we're doing this week. Seriously, I don't even know if what I'm writing here will show up anywhere. But in case it does, we're talking about space bugs, Halo Wars, Chun-Li: The Movie, Saskatoon, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11/26/2013
item.description: Atlus gets serious about another generation of video game consoles, Drew goes for a run. Brad and Vinny think about earning PP while Jeff lives the life of a pirate.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 11/25/2013
item.description: Former Harmonix and Twisted Pixel designer Dan Teasdale joins us to chat next-gen, his new studio, Internet dicks, and more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11/19/2013
item.description: "Scoops" of the popular morning show, Scoops & The Wolf, joins the team for a special video-game-themed episode, where we discuss current generation video game devices, like the Sony PlayStation 4, Microsoft Xbox One, and Nintendo Wii U.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 11/18/2013
item.description: The creative director of Supergiant Games, Greg Kasavin, joins us for an hour of light next-gen talk and inside baseball on game development.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 11/15/2013 -- "Still Awaiting Greatness"
item.description: No PS4s. No John. No JJ. No problem! ...well, OK, one problem with the audio near the start... BUT ANYWAY! CheapyD and Scott Popular pitch in to help go over everything we’ve seen and heard (and not played, yet) of Sony’s new system, plus Super Mario

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 11/15/2013
item.description: It's all PlayStation 4 on today's show, including wild and unsubstantiated theories about a new Uncharted.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Kojima on Ground Zeroes
item.description: Ten minutes and fewer questions with the man behind the Metal.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: PS4: The Canadian Perspective
item.description: Sony's Adam Boyes discusses the PlayStation 4's ability to hold its liquor and other pertinent topics.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11/12/2013
item.description: Brad talks about Dota 2, Jeff shares his years of industry knowledge, and Drew recalls his weekend adventures. EVERYTHING IS UNDER CONTROL!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: A Chat With Shuhei Yoshida
item.description: Sony's President of Worldwide Studios weighs in on all sorts of topics with just days to go till the PS4 launch.

item.title: Giant Bombcast EVE Online Edition
item.description: Brad, Jeff, and Ryan sit down with Noah Ward, lead game designer for EVE Online, to discuss the upcoming expansion and just what makes this no-holds-barred space MMO tick.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and Jeff Cannata: 11/11/2013
item.description: With the Wolf gone, I'm joined by Jeff Cannata to talk BlizzCon news, how crowdfunding might influence future media, and Knack, Knack, Knack.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 3: This Podcast Title Is Being Held in Abeyance
item.description: Our monthly-ish wrestling discussion finds us recounting what we can remember of the last two WWE pay-per-views, talking some WWE 2K14, trading some hot Japanese wrestling tapes, and considering what to do with a DVR full of unwatched TNA episodes.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 11/08/2013
item.description: Because who doesn't love a good discussion about Kameo: Elements of Power.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/31/2013 - The 25th Anniversary of the Sega Mega Drive
item.description: Let's get a little nostalgic with Jeff Gerstmann as we look back on the One True Greatest 16-bit platform, the Sega Genesis.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/17/2013 - Ubisoft Delays Watch Dogs, The Crew
item.description: Ubisoft has delayed Watch Dogs, one of the most anticipated holiday releases, into 2014 and Jeff Gerstmann is predictably bummed.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/10/2013 - New Consoles Coming Soon!
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is already tired of the online bickering about the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One and it's only October.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/03/2013 - Grand Theft Auto Online
item.description: Rockstar's online side to GTAV is here, and Jeff Gerstmann's having trouble getting this thing to work at all.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 09/26/2013 - SteamOS
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann returns with the first details on Valve's new living room initiatives.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Let's Spoil Beyond: Two Souls
item.description: Polygon's oldest brother, Justin McElroy, and Kotaku's resident musician, Kirk Hamilton, join us to ponder David Cage's latest.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11/05/2013: That's a Tuesday!
item.description: The Giant Bomb Gang reflects on its marathon livestreaming weekend while discussing deep Windjammers strats, Call of Duty For Ghosts, Kameo, that ill-advised pizza order, how to give candy to children, and a distinct lack of Diretide.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02-24-2009
item.description: This week's Bombcast is citrus fresh with the unbridled insanity of Noby Noby Boy, 50 Cent's gangsterous return to video games, the relationship between Ubisoft, Canada, and cheese, NSFW Flash games, an exciting new Giant Bomb contest, and more!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 11/05/2013
item.description: In which Patrick reenacts slightly falling down a stair and messing up his toes.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Great Escape of 30,000 Steam Keys
item.description: How an attempt to give away free copies of Wadjet Eye's Blackwell Deception went haywire, and tens of thousands of keys disappeared into the night.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Write What You Know, Learn What You Don't

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/29/2013

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Next Dark Descent Is Space
item.description: Thomas Grip is the co-founder of Frictional Games, who brought us the terrifying Amnesia: The Dark Descent. Their next project? SOMA, a sci-fi horror looking to explore the idea of the human soul.

item.description: Asylum Jam, taking place this upcoming weekend, is gathering developers to widen the scope of horror.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Aaron Foster Doesn't Want to Show You His Game
item.description: Routine wants to explore the terror of a very familiar object in the sky, and its developers want to show as little as possible before the game's done.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/08/2013
item.description: Vinny attempts to live out his solo crime saga while Jeff bangs his head against Grand Theft Auto V's online component. Meanwhile, Drew learns a valuable lesson about a different kind of automotive thievery. Brad buys a Wii U in preparation for the inevit

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 10/07/2013

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Horror of Making Horror

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/01/2013
item.description: The gang reconvenes to discuss Brad's Grand Theft Auto V vacation, Jeff's love of thunderstorms, Steam's odd future, Drew's descent into ArmA III, the power of alcohol, Vinny's voicework career, and the idea of playing Dota 2 on a controller.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/30/2013
item.description: Let's get together, and do our best to forget it's Monday.

item.description: The Bombcast avoids Olympic controversy with discussions of Killzone 2, Prince of Persia DLC, E3 2009, Need for Speed, Madden NFL 10, the next Jason Bourne game, Xbox 360 avatar perks, the Atari Jaguar, Resident Evil 5, and much more!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/27/2013

item.description: With that pesky Brad Shoemaker out on vacation, we can finally get down and dirty with the rest of the team's favorite game, Dota 2. Grand Theft Auto V, America's Cup, fireworks, SteamOS, and way more video games are also discussed.

item.description: Steven Applebaum and his partner, Ryan Hoss, are obsessed with the Super Mario Bros. live action film. Not only do they run a fan site, but they've partnered with one of the screenwriters to produce a sequel in comic form.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Future Is Voxels
item.description: Voxels are everywhere in EverQuest Next, thanks to Miguel Cepero's Voxel Farm technology. The man is betting big on a technology most associate with Outcast, and he explained to me why we shouldn't dismiss it.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/23/2013
item.description: Uh, who invited these other guys? One Jeff Gerstmann and Neverending Nightmares' Matt Gilgenbach join us for today's show.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 2 -- Kiss Me and I'll Kiss You Ryback
item.description: The greatest wrestling minds in video games reunite to talk SummerSlam stories, Daniel Bryan's championship blue balls, NXT, and the beautiful, platonic love between man and walrus.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/20/2013
item.description: It's the end of GTA week. Nobody's had ANY opinions about that game.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-27-2009
item.description: Enjoy the muffled sounds of madness as we discuss the emerging EAverse, Operation: Anchorage, inappropriate applications of fried chicken, appropriate applications of evil cat people, the Bernie Madoff of EVE Online, Street Fiver, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 09/12/2013 - PlayStation Vita TV
item.description: Finally, a portable system that gets all that portable stuff out of the way! Jeff Gerstmann talks about Sony's new TV-focused Vita hardware.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09-17-2013 [PREMIUM]
item.description: Jeff has some things to say about Grand Theft Auto V while Vinny attempts to talk Brad off the ledge after a dismal Dota 2 weekend. Meanwhile Drew looks on from his jet simulator, disapprovingly.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09-17-2013
item.description: Jeff has some things to say about Grand Theft Auto V while Vinny attempts to talk Brad off the ledge after a dismal Dota 2 weekend. Meanwhile Drew looks on from his jet simulator, disapprovingly.

item.description: Happy GTA review day! Join two people who haven't played the one thing you want to hear about this morning.

item.description: Need to know when the PlayStation 4 is coming out? Well they announced that this week in Germany, and Jeff Gerstmann has your pertinent details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 08/15/2013 - Saints Row IV
item.description: President Gerstmann is here to push his platform of nudity, destruction, and references to great action films of the 1980s alongside the release of Saints Row IV.
