item.description: Jeff Gerstmann returns to the weird world of Rise of the Triad with the release of its new reboot.

item.title: Box Office Bomb: Episode 8
item.description: We didn't see Riddick, but we did see a bunch of other stuff! Tune in for talk of Jackie Brown! Side Effects and Soderbergh! The Last-est Exorcism! An October devoid of horror! And the timeless well of comedy that is Ennio Morricone's back catalogue!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-20-2009
item.description: We celebrate Inauguration Day with a UK drink taste-test, copious discussions of Street Fighter IV, Skate 2, Knothole Island, our collective frustration over the PS3, the cinematic influences of Metal Gear Solid 4, and more. Have fun at dinner!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 09/13/2013
item.description: Please stow your laptops and power triangles as we depart for our special 84th (!) episode, with first-blush Monster Hunter 4 and Jojo's Bizarre Adventure All-Star Battle, thoughts on Vita TV and the revamped Vita handheld, PS4's rumored headset and virtu

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/13/2013
item.description: We run the gamut on Friday morning. GTA V? Check. Papers, Please? You got it. LeBron? Of course!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Checking Your Blind Spots
item.description: Narrative designer Anna Megill was part of a panel at PAX that gathered game writers together to discuss building stories for wider audiences and the missteps along the way.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09-10-2013
item.description: Vinny returns from vacation with a secret. Brad ponders the fate of open-world video games. Drew crashes a Jetski. Jeff looks on, disapprovingly. Dota 2 gets caught up in a liquor store heist gone horribly wrong.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Maybe Addiction Isn't Worth Bragging About
item.description: Ryan Black is a lawyer. Dr. Tyler Black is psychiatrist. They're twin brothers, and they have some very interesting theories about where the law and video games might intersect in the not-too-distant future.
Apparently Sony held a press conference last night?
With the week nearing its end, it turns out no topic is too controversial for these two.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: How Keiji Inafune Became Kickstarter's Latest Success Story
item.description: The creator of Mega Man is busy refreshing his Kickstarter page for Mighty No. 9, a spiritual successor that's already passed $1.5 million. At PAX, we talked about how this game came to be, and Japan's awareness of Kickstarter.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-13-2009
item.description: We're joined by former EGM editor Giancarlo Varanini for discussions of the Windows 7 beta, the future of Tony Hawk, the escalating madness surrounding Bob's Game, Serena Altschul on PCP, McRib virginity, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-08-2008
item.description: This week we give you all we’ve got with discussions of the stuff that plants crave, Kazooie’s Funtime Party Assassins, Ikaruga, what the X in Tom Clancy’s H.A.W.X. stands for, and more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Bumpy Road Towards Games for Everyone
item.description: Designer Samantha Kalman was on a PAX panel called "Queers in Gaming: Gamer vs. Gaymer," in which the panelists tried to explore the challenges of making more inclusionary games. Before that panel, we chatted about the current state of the dialogue.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09-03-2013
item.description: Jeff, Brad, and Drew go over their final PAX notes to discuss Samurai Gunn, Grand Theft Auto V, Steamworld Dig, games for the Vita, extreme PAX panel injuries, D.O.T.A. II, potential butt energy, and a hot grip of your emails on this emails-focused podcas

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Matt Gilgenbach's Neverending Nightmares
item.description: An all-too-short conversation with 24 Caret Games designer Matt Gilgenbach about making a game that channels his real-life issues.
Grab your coffee, and sit down. PAX is over, but it hasn't left our thoughts quite yet.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Enduring Legacy of EarthBound's Writing
item.description: To Marcus Lindblom, translating EarthBound was just one of many projects. It was a special one, but the game was a flop. Years later, he's finally learning just how much people love that series.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-06-2009
item.description: The Giant Bombcast returns for the 200Crime with mustaches, AustraliaBux, Dave Snider's fun facts about Washington, D.C., a talkbox, the awesome Crank 2: High Voltage trailer, Lego Rock Band, the Killzone 2 demo, and much more!

item.title: Box Office Bomb 8-30-13
item.description: Hey, let's talk about Affleckman! And Elysium! And The World's End! And some other stuff! It's a premium movie podcast thing!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Hideki Kamiya Doesn't Yell So Much in Real-Life
item.description: One of gaming's most outspoken designers on Twitter, Hideki Kamiya needs little introduction. Resident Evil, Devil May Cry, Okami--the list goes on and on. Next up is The Wonderful 101, which became our starting point for a conversation on his past, prese

item.title: 8-4 Play: 08/30/2013
item.description: We're off to PAX and a special sumthin' sumthin' -- but first, more on the Wonderful 101, Killer is Dead, Divekick, the 2DS announcement, PS4 and XBONE launch comparison, Gamescom news (and fresh rumors), and more!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Facebook Wants to Get Serious About Games
item.description: A recent partnership with Unity should allow a wider variety of games to show up on Facebook. I chatted with product manager for games George Lee about how it's trying to change Facebook's image.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Dragging the Shmup Into 2013 With Galak-Z
item.description: 17-Bit creative director Jake Kazdal talks about life after the frustrating release of Skulls of the Shogun, his goals for the future, and his new baby, Galak-Z.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08/27/2013
item.description: This week's podcast gets down and dirty on the real with further discussion of submarines, Saints Row IV, Lost Planet 3, Splinter Cell, trying to buy a hybrid, Final Fantasy XIV-2, bathroom design, how to handle dust, and all the Dota 2 that you can possi

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Are Competitive Players Also Athletes?
item.description: A conversation with fighting game commentator (and lawyer!) David "UltraDavid" Graham about the government recognizing competitive gaming, the tensions around the term eSports, and much more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Game of the Year 2008 Edition
item.description: We let you inside our GOTY deliberation process as we debate the relative merits of Burnout Paradise, Grand Theft Auto IV, Metal Gear Solid 4, Gears of War 2, Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts and Bolts, Dead Space, Braid, Left 4 Dead, Fallout 3, and Fable II.
With just a few days before PAX, Patrick and Alex look ahead to a week of beer, duders, and dumptrucks.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The BioForge Interview
item.description: We tracked down BioForge director, programmer, and producer Ken Demarest to discuss the origins, development, and legacy of his 1995 game.
We virtually fly back from Gamescom, wonder about hardware strategies for Xbox and PS4, ruminate on Wolf Among Us, and crown an artwork victor.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-23-2008
item.description: Our last proper podcast of 2008 includes our pleas to euthanize Sonic the Hedgehog, hot sandos, cyborg zombies, the last Christmas song, predictions for 2009, and more. Be sure to come back next week for our special Game of the Year podcast!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 08/01/2013 - BioShock Infinite DLC
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann brings you the details on BioShock Infinite's upcoming paid add-ons.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/25/2013 - Animal Crossing: New Leaf
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann returns from the island, where he's been chopping down trees and stuffing his pockets full of beetles.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/18/2013 - Rogue Legacy
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann returns to tell you about his time with Rogue Legacy, its randomized castle, and its generations of fighters.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: From Games Press to Game Developer
item.description: Gunpoint is a hell of a debut from designer and ex-PC Gamer writer Tom Francis. We talk about why he's thought about making games for years but never took the chance.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Alex Asks Some Wrestlers About Some Stuff
item.description: Mick Foley talks Wrestlemania moments, Daniel Bryan talks predictive beard technology, and Steve Austin crafts a pretty spectacular analogy for wrestling fame.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Cory Ledesma Talks WWE 2K14, His Favorite Wrestlemania Moments, and More
item.description: Yes, VGCW fans, I asked him about the story editor. I'll leave it to you to decide if you're satisfied with the answer.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-16-2008
item.description: We share our thoughts on the Spike TV Video Game Awards, drink Dissidia potions, make fun of PlayStation Home, try to make sense of Noby Noby Boy, speculate on Niko Bellic's fate in The Lost and the Damned, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-20-2013
item.description: The gang gets together to discuss John Cena's catchphrase, the magic of Disney Infinity, the even-more-magic of krokodil, Dota 2, Gone Home, Ultima Forever vs. Plants vs. Zombies, War Thunder, GTA Online, and the value of pretending to be into football.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: So, What's XCOM: Enemy Within?
item.description: XCOM: Enemy Unknown senior designer Ananda Gupta teases what's in store for the game's upcoming expansion.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Xbox's Chris Charla Breaks Down ID@Xbox
item.description: Microsoft used Gamescom to reveal its Independent Developers @ Xbox program, and I had a chance to talk with the director of the program about what the company hopes to accomplish.
Alex reminisces about his supremely weird WWE weekend, Patrick reflects on the response to his Gone Home review, and holy crap, it's early in the morning.
Dean Dodrill, creator of Dust: An Elysian Tail, join your hosts for a discussion about Steam summer sales and the week's headlines.

item.title: 8-4 Play: SUMMER GAMES

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: EVO's Founder Explains the Scene's New Collusion Rule
item.description: Tom "Inkblot" Cannon is teaming up with tournament organizers to help make watching fighting games more competitive and more fun.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-09-2008
item.description: Following some heinous technical difficulties, it's take two of this week's Giant Bombcast! With Jeff as our one-man house band, we discuss Prince of Persia, Square Enix and Eidos, turning a DSi into a talkbox, Crackdown 2, Michael Phelps, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-13-2013
item.description: The Giant Bomb Podcast Gang reconvenes to talk about Microsoft's inability to commit, Vinny's ability to Pikmin, introducing new people to the Oculus Rift, and a new multiplayer online battle arena video game called Dota II.
Patrick and Alex turn on some microphones, talk about games, and learn to accept Monday morning. AWOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!

item.title: The Power Bombcast Episode One: VINTAGE GERSTMANN!
item.description: Alex, Jeff, Giancarlo, Jared, and Dan drag you into the terrifying, bizarre, and misbegotten world of professional wrestling (and its related video games) in this first episode of the Power Bombcast.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-06-2013
item.description: We pile five-deep into a room to discuss the finer points of Uncle Luke, the magic of iRacing, Bioshock Infinite's add-ons, what it's like to speak directly to the Ultimate Warrior, beeeeeees, Atlus, and why you should NEVER bet on DBZ. Dota 2.

item.title: Untitled Giant Bomb Movie Podcast 08-02-2013
item.description: The Wolverine: tentatively pretty good! Only God Forgives: tentatively not really that good unless you're a beret-wearing film student (some early-film spoilers from 32:00 to 44:00)! Batman Vs. Superman! Age of Ultron! User questions! It's a podcast!

item.title: 8-4 Play: #REGGIEFORSMASHBROS
item.description: Join us for a second helping of Pikmin 3 talk followed by first impressions of Dragon's Crown, Mario & Luigi: Dream Team, Ace Attorney: Dual Destinies, and a whopping 17 seconds on Rogue Legacy. Plus: the Capcom 13 (BOF6?!), Mike Tyson vs. Glass Joe,

item.title: Patrick & Alex's Morning Thing! 07/31/2013
item.description: These guys aren't in San Francisco, but that's not gonna stop 'em.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-30-2013
item.description: The cast and crew of Giant Bomb dot com get together to discuss the PAX 10, Drew's trip to an aircraft carrier, Ridiculous Fishing, Phil Fishing, Reel Fishing, real fishing, and Valve's hot new online strategy game, Defense of the Ancients II.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Irrational Games' Ken Levine and Forrest Dowling Talk BioShock Infinite DLC
item.description: From the clouds to the sea, we get the scoop on what's going on with Infinite's downloadable content.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 07/04/2013 - Watch_Dogs
item.description: What's Jeff's most exciting game coming out of E3 2013? It's Ubisoft's upcoming hack-filled action-adventure, Watch_Dogs.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-02-2008
item.description: We recover from our tryptophan poisoning with discussions of the screechy announcer from You're In the Movies, Assassin's Creed 2, the future of Midway, Nathan Drake's chain wallet, the winner of our Gears of War 2 Zune contest, Anime Vice, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/27/2013 - Xbox One Backtrack
item.description: Microsoft buckles to online criticism and reverses one of its upcoming console's most controversial policies.

item.description: Another set of policy changes for Microsoft's next console, another interview trying to figure out as much as we can.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-23-2013
item.description: We let Zartan burn as we discuss the right time to release DLC, getting/being old, Rockapella, this "Dota 2" game, and that evil Nintendo salesrabbit.

item.title: Untitled Giant Bomb Movie Podcast 07-19-2013
item.description: Pacific Rim gets dissected and it comes out approved, but not unscathed! Spoilers start at 13:00 and end around 23:30! And there's more stuff to talk about! So we'll talk about it! Talk!

item.description: The former designer on games like Deus Ex and BioShock 2 is getting up close and personal for his debut independent effort, The Novelist.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-16-2013
item.description: Bombcast! continues with some bootleg high-pitched music, video games to play when you barely feel like playing video games, and... Dota 2. Yeah, again.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Alex Tried to Interview the Ultimate Warrior
item.description: It was, uh, interesting.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: 2K Sports' Bryan Williams Talks WWE 2K14, Publisher Changes, and King of Colosseum
item.description: I did not expect to have a WWE designer name drop one of my favorite Japanese PS2 wrestling games. Not that I'm complaining.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-09-2013
item.description: Giant Bomb comes together to remember our dear friend and colleague, Ryan Davis.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11-25-2008

item.title: 8-4 Play: THIS IS YOUR NEXT PODCAST

item.title: Untitled Giant Bomb Movie Podcast 07-3-2013
item.description: Alex and Rorie discuss World War Z, The Lone Ranger, Monsters University, and more! This podcast was recorded two weeks ago, but not posted until now. We'll have another one for you later this week!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-02-2013
item.description: Jeff, Brad, and Drew sit back and spin a yarn about surfing, the Saints, Don Mattrick, the infinite power of cloud magic, and... sure, numbers stations. Why not?

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-25-2013
item.description: We talk The Biggest Little City, The Last of Us, the fate of Phantasy Star Online 2, virtual Slurpee machines, Ken Levine's Logan's Run, bricked PlayStation 3s, Microsoft's shocking Xbox One DRM policy revision, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/20/2013 - Titanfall
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is back from Los Angeles and ready to tell the CBS Radio world about Respawn's new multiplayer shooter.

item.title: 8-4 Play: THERE AND BACK AGAIN

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Listen to Microsoft's Marc Whitten Explain Yesterday's Xbox One News
item.description: Patrick was given just a few minutes to learn a little bit more about Microsoft's huge moves in the last 24 hours.

item.title: Untitled Giant Bomb Movie Podcast 06-19-2013
item.description: Man of Steel: The Story of Jesus gets broken down in the latest edition of the UGBMPthing, and Alex and Rorie also talk This Is The End, Frances Ha, the prospects of World War Z, and a bunch of other stuff!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/13/2013 - Fantasia: Music Evolved
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is always a sucker for a good rhythm game, even if Disney has to get involved.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 06/06/2013 - E3 2013
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's sandwich game is tight as hell and he's ready to uncover the future of video games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11-18-2008
item.description: It's the video-game podcast that eats like a meal, where we discuss Left 4 Dead, Halo Wars, our Gears of War 2 Zune giveaway, the romantic relationship between dinosaurs and automobiles, Brad's dad, and more. And we do it all with robot voices!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-18-2013
item.description: Before we ship Patrick off to the hot streets of Chicago, we get the gang back together to reflect on the events of E3 2013.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Dear E3 Diary: Part 02
item.description: The rest of E3 remains a blur, but to keep it real, Patrick spoke into a microphone the whole time. Listen for knee-jerk reactions to games, news, and the show, while taking in the many interviews he conducted during E3 2013.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Cloudberry Kingdom Promises Infinite Levels, Infinite Screaming
item.description: Finally, a game for the platforming masochist who doesn't think games are hard enough. Cloudberry Kingdom's developers have spent four years perfecting an algorithm that develops brand-new levels on the fly--and it works.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Shinji Mikami Returns to the Throne
item.description: The Evil Within marks the father of modern survival horror's return to the genre. A man of few words, designer Shinji Mikami explains why he's back, what it's like to work with an American publisher, and what scares him.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2013 Day Three
item.description: E3 2013: case closed.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: I Asked Nintendo Some Questions, But Didn't Get Many Answers
item.description: The future of Virtual Console? Metroid? Other Retro games? The status of Earthbound? These are things I wanted to know. Sadly, Nintendo's senior communications director, Charlie Scibetta, wasn't budging.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2013 Day Two
item.description: We bring Cliff Bleszinski, Jonathan Blow, Vince Zampella and the Respawn team, John Drake and Eric Pope from Harmonix, and Double Fine's own Brad Muir in for questioning.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: A Loud Show Floor Is No Place for a Horror Game
item.description: Alexandere Sabourin is a senior artist on Outlast, an Amnesia-inspired horror game where a photojournalist decides investigating an insane asylum is a smart idea. What scares a developer of scary games? Find out.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: We Talked to Denis Dyack
item.description: The usually loud and brash game designer has adopted a softer, more apologetic tone when pitching his spiritual successor to Eternal Darkness, Shadow of the Eternals. WARNING: some Eternal Darkness and Game of Thrones spoilers!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: E3 2013: The Bethesda Report
item.description: Patrick and Brad talk The Evil Within, Wolfenstein: The New Order, and Elder Scrolls Online.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11-11-2008
item.description: This week's topics include Resistance 2, Mirror's Edge, other people's property in LittleBigPlanet, Fallout 3's cultural sensitivity, the used-game scourge, Infinity Ward's bolt-action beef, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2013 Day One
item.description: Special guests from Naughty Dog, Polygon, Gearbox, Game Informer, and more join us for our first nightly wrap-up from E3 2013. Includes bonus pre-show banter!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: This Dude Holds the Future of Darksiders in His Hands
item.description: Nordic Games acquired a bunch of THQ franchises earlier this year, including Darksiders, MX vs. ATV, and Titan Quest. The company's head of business and product development, Reinhard Pollice, breaks down what it's like to participate in the auction of a d

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Another Day, Another Cab
item.description: Let's chat in a taxi about what we're doing today.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Dear E3 Diary: Part 01
item.description: Patrick's been at E3 2013 for a few days now. But ever since he left for the airport in San Francisco, he's been rambling into a microphone about what he's seen, what he's played, and when he's tired. What a terrible idea.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Having Your Game in a Press Conference Is Terrifying
item.description: Tribute Games co-founder Jean-François Major explains why Mercenary Kings is now coming to PS4, and life after WIZZZZZZZZOOOORRRBBBBBBB.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Sony's Scott Rohde Answers Your Burning PS4 Questions
item.description: Patrick spends 30 minutes talking PS4 policies with Scott Rohde, SVP of product development at Sony's worldwide studios division. Online passes? Charging for multiplayer? External hard drives? We cover it all.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Yappin' About Quantum Break and Infamous: Second Son
item.description: Alex and Brad chat about two respective Xbox One and PS4 exclusives.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2013: The Sealed Envelope
item.description: Recorded prior to Monday's dramatic press conferences, Jeff shares more of his Judges' Week experiences, while the whole staff makes predictions that are, in hindsight, hilarious.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Alex and Brad, in a Cab
item.description: Talkin' about E3 on the way to E3!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: How to Make a Living on Someone Else's Game
item.description: For some people, making add-ons for popular games is a hobby. For Ben "Bronto ϟ Thunder" Retter, it's his livelihood. What are the ins and outs of creating your own commercial content for a game made by people you don't even know?

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11-04-2008
item.description: We shake off Halloween and do our best to avoid politics with in-depth discussions of Vinny's DJ ghosts, Brad's internet-savvy ant farm, the NXE, The Beatles, Marcus Fenix at home, impossible achievements, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-01-2008
item.description: Get on the yellow bus with Jeff and Ryan for another edition of the Giant Bombcast! This week we turn our eyes towards Cinnabon: The Drink, the end of superbike confusion, the problems with Liars’ Day, the off-road future of Burnout, and much more!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 06/07/2013
item.description: We designed the new 8-4 Play so that game publishers can enable you and up to 10 family members to hear about facts, rumors, and wild speculation on E3, including games like Dark Souls 2, MGS5, Destiny, Killer is Dead, Smash Bros., the new 3D Mario, Zelda

item.title: Untitled Giant Bomb Movie Podcast 06-5-2013
item.description: Alex and Rorie are back, with some discussion of 2013's finest comedy, After Earth (spoilers end around 19:00)! Also: The Hangover 3, Game of Thrones (spoilers end 40:30 and 53:53-54:30), and various other entertainment-y events! The summer's in full swin

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-04-2013
item.description: We stress out about E3s past and future, free-to-play games, Kickstarter, and more! Mostly E3, though.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/30/2013 - The Xbox One
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann took a trip up to Microsoft to get a first glimpse at its upcoming TV box, the Xbox One.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/23/2013 - Fast & Furious Showdown
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is probably the type of idiot that would try to play a licensed movie game, even though most of them are complete garbage. Maybe Fast & Furious Showdown will be different?

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/16/2013 - The New Xbox Is Coming
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is booking a flight and getting ready to find out about that next Xbox.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-28-2013
item.description: Vinny dives into the sordid world of voice-acting for toys and grapples with gophers, Jeff shares his first weekend with the Oculus Rift, and we all discuss FUSE, Valve economics, next-gen aftermarkets, The Swapper, the dark side of Star Trek, and more!

item.title: Untitled Giant Bomb Movie Podcast 05-24-2013
item.description: It's Alex and Rorie, here for the first installment of a periodical podcast talkin' about movies! Get our thoughts on Star Trek: Into Darkness, Pain & Gain, Iron Man 3, and Fast 6.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 5/24/2013
item.description: The new controller Kinecting, Halo TV multi-tasking, temperature-reading, sometimes / always / never-online, Quantum Breaking, EA-bro-fisting, Cheapy D'ing, Call-of-Duty fine-hair splitting, smart-glassing, Ray Barnholtin', fingernail-dirt-meets-water-coo

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Talking Xbox One With Microsoft's Albert Penello
item.description: While Microsoft might not be ready to nail down specifics on some of the most incendiary topics surrounding the Xbox One, Jeff still covers friends lists, achievements, apps, and a handful of other topics in this 20-minute talk recorded shortly after the

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10-28-2008
item.description: We get juiced up on goji berries to discuss the current tsunami of new releases, including Dead Space, Far Cry 2, Fallout 3, LittleBigPlanet, and Guitar Hero World Tour, as well as Mortal Kombat vs. DC Universe, John Carmack's rockets, and more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-21-2013
item.description: Hot on the heels of Microsoft's Xbox One reveal event, we talk at length about the forthcoming next-gen console battle. Also Star Trek. And spiders. Go Bears!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 05/17/2013
item.description: Doritos Crash Course 2, Blood Dragon, interns, Pandora's Tower, La Mulana, Dragon Fantasy, interns, Animal Crossing, Monster Hunter, Sorcery, Star Command, interns, NextBox speculation, Nintendo's E3, interns, BS crowdfunding campaigns, GT6, and interns.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: This Designer Wants You to Hide in the Woods
item.description: Benjamin Rivers is the creator of the choose-your-own-horror game Home, coming soon to iOS. Patrick called him up, and they wouldn't stop talking about horror games, movies, and everything in-between.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-14-2013
item.description: With Jeff out of the office on pre-E3 business, we spend an inordinate amount of time on Durango speculation while also finding the time to talk Metro: Last Light, Wolfenstein: The New Order, Prison Architect, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/09/2013 - Grand Theft Auto V
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann gets back from his GTAV demo with a little info about how all this character switching will work.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Some Men Just Want to Watch the Universe Burn
item.description: Eyjolfur Gudmundsson is EVE Online's chief economist. Like real-life, its economy goes up, down, and has recessions. CCP even has an Internal Affairs department to regulate those with too much information.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 05/02/2013 - Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann whisks you away to the far-flung future of 2007, where blood dragons walk the Earth and cybercommandos steal the hearts of their foes.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 04/25/2013 - Dead Island: Riptide
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann fills you in on this substandard sequel to Techland's zombie nightmare, Dead Island.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-07-2013
item.description: Ryan mistakes Bob Hoskins for dead; Jeff loves Riff-Raff; Vinny loves sleep; Brad loves Dota 2; Patrick loves Ellen; the gang learns what the best console is; the Shmoo is real.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 05/03/2013
item.description: La Mulana, Monaco, Crimson Clover, Tomodachi Collection, Mother 4 / Earthbound 2 (3?), Robot Unicorn Attack 2, Neo-Geo collecting, Wii U firmware updates, Nintendo's E3 show no-show, Famicom trivia, and NextBox scuttlebutt ('cause hey, we DO comment on ru

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bombkast: Ed Boon Edition
item.description: Jeff, Brad, and Ryan sit down with Mortal Kombat co-creator Ed Boon to discuss MK's place in the world of fighting games, the state of arcades, the potential for Mortal Kombat Vs. Street Fighter, and more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Gimme FTL Drives, Asteroid Mining, and Space Elevators
item.description: So...when? Three experts flew to Iceland to provide us with some answers. EVE Online Fanfest 2013 was host to three "Make EVE Real" panels, in which leading scientists broke down how some of EVE Online's technology may show up sooner than you think. Techn

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Every Vote Counts in EVE Online
item.description: Mark "Seleene" Heard is not only a former CCP designer, he's part of EVE Online's Council of Stellar Management. Members are chosen through a player-driven election, and are charged with communicating the will of the people to the developers. It's just as

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-30-2013
item.description: Patrick's back from Iceland with three solid hours of Bjork stories.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: What Drives a Man to Travel Thousands of Miles for a Game
item.description: Zakn is just one of the many EVE Online players who traveled to Iceland for its annual gathering. More than 1,400 from around the world come to spend only a few days together. We traveled to the source for answers.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-23-2013
item.description: Brad discovers a use for interns in Dota 2; Patrick prepares for Reyjkavik; Ryan endorses the Neti pot; Jeff is assaulted by the Neti pot; Vinny hangs drywall.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: When Hollywood Isn't Enough
item.description: Lionel Gallat was an animation director at DreamWorks, and helped craft blockbuster films like Despicable Me and The Lorax. Secretly, though, he wanted to make video games. With the help of crowdfunding, he hopes to tell the story of a tiny mouse on a big

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10-21-2008
item.description: We return to the glorious US of A to discuss the current deluge of hot, hot games, including Fable II, SOCOM: Confrontation, Saints Row 2, LittleBigPlanet, and much more!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 04/19/2013
item.description: Ryan Payton (Republique) and Chris Kohler (Wired GameLife) join the gang for an epic, sprawling, heated discussion focusing on retro collecting, indie development, and the present and future of the Wii U. Pit stops on Guacamelee, Tomodachi Collection 3DS

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Why This Insane Designer Ported His Game About Linux to DOS
item.description: Two years ago, Bryan Lunduke made a game about creating the most popular Linux distro. It was a joke, but became oddly popular. Then, he decided porting it to MS-DOS was the funniest thing in the world. He's got a point.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 04/18/2013 - Injustice: Gods Among Us
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann punches his way through the latest fighting game from the Mortal Kombat team in this week's installment.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-16-2013
item.description: Vinny finds new homes for old possessions; Jeff fantasizes about his own Coke Freestyle machine; Patrick considers a new hat; Ryan is sleepy; Brad is named Bombcast Ombudsman.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 04/11/2013 - Defiance
item.description: Defiance is an action-shooter MMO game with a TV show tie-in. Jeff Gerstmann's here to let you know if the game part is any good.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 04/04/2013 - BioShock Infinte
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann weighs in on Irrational's latest release, BioShock Infinite.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Dean Evans Really Loves RoboCop
item.description: Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon revels in its influences in a way most games only do through easter eggs, and feels like the personification of its creative director, Dean Evans. Dean's an exceptionally smart, funny guy who has zero problem liking crappy things.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-09-2013
item.description: Vinny returns with harrowing tales of airplanes, babies, and bathtubs; Patrick combines his love of BioShock and Lost into a... Singularity; Jeff tries to make sense of Defiance; Brad falls down a Dota 2 hole; everyone mourns the passing of LucasArts.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 04/05/2013
item.description: With Gaming Jesus on a secret pilgrimage, the task falls to the few, the proud, the 8-4 interns (and the rest of us), to fill his massive void. Er… Anyway, this week it’s GDC, Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate, Nimble Quest, Year Walk, MGS5 and David Hayter-gate, Square Enix’s shake-up, PSO2?s delay, Skullgirls’ crowdfunding, Fire Emblem feet, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10-12-2008
item.description: We wrap up our business in Tokyo with talk of cosplayers, Kingdom Hearts, more terrible Swedish candy, capsule toys, and more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Vander Caballero Just Wanted to Tell His Story
item.description: Patrick had a chance to speak with Papo & Yo designer Vander Caballero last September. They discuss the inspirations behind Papo & Yo, the huge emotional response it generated, and what it's like to say goodbye.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04/02/2013
item.description: After back-to-back PAX East and GDC, it's a decidedly low-key week on the Bombcast. We fight off the malaise with spoiler-free BioShock Infinite talk, Ouya impressions, Metal Gear Solid V thoughts, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 03/28/2013 - PAX East & GDC
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann tells you about PAX East and GDC (but conveniently leaves out the bit about the GDC pie-flushing contest).

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Most Affable Man in Video Games Is Now an Academic
item.description: Richard Lemarchand was a lead designer at Naughty Dog, where he worked on the Uncharted series and other games. Now, he's a visiting associate professor of the interactive media division at the University of Southern California's school of cinematic arts.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Scoops vs. Hot Scoops
item.description: The battle for whose voice is more rattled on Friday morning rages on. The Fullbright Company designer Steve Gaynor talks about showing Gone Home, a game best suited for a quiet place, at a stupidly loud venue like GDC.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Robin Arnott's Transition From Terrifying Players to Chilling You the 'Eff Out
item.description: SoundSelf, which is currently raising money on Kickstarter, is all about going WHAAAAAAAAAAAA into a microphone. Sort of. Literally. Kind of. Look, just listen.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: XCOM: Enemy Unknown's Jake Solomon Really Loves Ultima V
item.description: Firaxis is bringing XCOM: Enemy Unknown to iOS, and it works better than you might expect. Lead designer Jake Solomon ruminates on the porting process, and watching his daughter play touch-based games.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 03/21/2013 - Gears of War: Judgment
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's ready to sit down and tell you all about this Gears of War prequel.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Developer of Papers, Please Tells Us His Thoughts, Please
item.description: Lucas Pope spends his time traveling, and it got him thinking about the life of the men and women who work at immigration checkpoints. Pope reflects on his design process, and how players react to his empathetic games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10-10-2008
item.description: With the second day of the 2008 Tokyo Game Show behind us, we discuss Halo 3 Recon, White Knight Chronicles, Let's Tap, Yakuza 3, the current state of TGS and video-game trade shows in general, and much more.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Frantic, Mile-a-Minute Mind Behind The Stanley Parable
item.description: The Stanley Parable is a phenomenally interesting and thoughful mod for Half-Life 2. Now, creator Davey Wreden is remaking it. Why? How? Maybe Steve "I'll just butt into this interview, Patrick" Gaynor can help us figure it out.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Trying to Unify Indie Game Developers in Japan Isn't Easy
item.description: La Mulana's creators are reaching out to other Japanese developers at GDC, and the PLAYISM service hopes to unify them. Asterizm VP of game production Takumi Naramura and Active Gaming Media content acquisition director Joshua Weatherford talk about their

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-26-2013
item.description: Ryan, Jeff, and Patrick return from PAX East 2013 exhausted, excited, and looking forward to the shenanigans promised by GDC 2013. Now! Who wants pie?

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: This Guy Wrote a Whole Book on Spec Ops: The Line
item.description: Game critic Brendan Keogh was struck by the messages embedded in Spec Ops: The Line, so he started writing about it. 50,000 words later, he had the book "Killing is Harmless: A Critical Reading of Spec Ops: The Line."

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Hey, Brad Muir, Let's Talk About Monster Hunter
item.description: Patrick managed to grab Double Fine designer Brad Muir in-between GDC panels to talk a little MoHun, and the process of setting up two different systems to play one game.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: 8-4 Explains How It's Making Translations Better at GDC
item.description: John, Mark, and Hiroko aren't just at GDC to hang out and drink beer (though that happens). They're also helping Japanese game designers explain their vision. Here's how.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: How to Do In-App Purchases Without Pissing Everyone Off
item.description: Ninja Robot Dinosaur's Shane Neville knows how to balance a game, having worked on Company of Heroes. Learn how his studio implemented in-app purchases for Shellrazer without feeling horrible about it.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 03/23/2013
item.description: Luigi’s Mansion 2, Ridiculous Fishing, Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate, Dark Souls (yes, again!), BitSummit, Dragon’s Crown, Wii U troubles, Vita triumphs (and troubles), Durango rumors, Drakengard 3, Phantom Pain, Transistor, and oh-so-much more!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Kill Screen Co-Founder Chris Dahlen on Games, Stories, and Why They're Hard
item.description: Chris Dahlen wrote the script for Mark of the Ninja, which gave him the unique opportunity to have first-hand experience with the challenges of stories in video games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10-09-2008
item.description: Brad, Jeff, and Ryan wrap up the first day of the 2008 Tokyo Game Show with some of their personal highlights.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: From Halo to BioShock Infinite to...Third Eye Crime
item.description: The lead AI programmer on Halo 2 and 3, Damian Isla, has taken years of experience to his own game, a thrilling puzzler about a telepathic art thief.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Mommy's Best Games' Nathan Fouts on Making More Accessible Games
item.description: Former Insomniac Games programmer Nathan Fouts has been doing it indie on his own for years. He's also been going out his way to make his games more accessible to the disabled.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Hacking Brendon Chung and His Quadrilateral Cowboy
item.description: A few minutes with the designer of Gravity Bone, 30 Flights of Loving, and the upcoming hacker-centric Quadrilateral Cowboy.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: 20 Minutes With Metro 2033 Author Dmitry Glukhovsky
item.description: The Interview Dumptruck travels to PAX East 2013! Metro 2033 and Metro Last Light are based on the universe created by Russian author Dmitry Glukhovsky. We chat about the difficulties getting published in America, the origins of Metro, and why his work is

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Giant Bomb's Interview Dumptruck: Nels Anderson 03/20/2013
item.description: Lead designer Nels Anderson explains Klei's decision to pull the trigger on Mark of the Ninja: Special Edition, and what it means for fans of ninjas 'n stabbing.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-19-2013
item.description: We talk about "smart" watches and the inevitable Cyborg Wars while occasionally slipping into a little Gears of War: Judgment, Monster Hunter (!?!?!), and mooooore.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Giant Bomb's Interview Dumptruck: Peter Bartholow 03/15/2013
item.description: The huge response to our recent feature on the developers of Skullgirls asking for $100,000 to implement a new character surprised even us. Learn more by listening to our interview with Lab Zero Games CEO Peter Bartholow.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 03/14/2013 - Tomb Raider
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is back to tell you about Lara Croft's latest island adventure.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 790: MILE HIGH MUDSLIDE
item.description:
This week we continue to talk about Tears of the Kingdom and how it might be one of our alltime favorites! We also talk about Brain Age, Cassette Beasts, and more!
Grubb also gets into this week's biggest gaming headlines and we dip into your emails!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 790: MILE HIGH MUDSLIDE
item.description:
This week we continue to talk about Tears of the Kingdom and how it might be one of our alltime favorites! We also talk about Brain Age, Cassette Beasts, and more!
Grubb also gets into this week's biggest gaming headlines and we dip into your emails!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 03/07/2013 - SimCity
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann wades through the server issues to tell you more about EA's latest city builder.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10-08-2008
item.description: Giant Bomb's J-pop ecstacy nightmare continues as the boys take a trip to Akihabara.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 789: Ewoks and Hobbits
item.description: Our dear friend Lucy James is here with us and with the Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom finally here we ask the question that's on all our minds: Do you think Ewoks are better than Hobbits?

item.title: Giant Bombcast 789: Ewoks and Hobbits
item.description: Our dear friend Lucy James is here with us and with the Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom finally here we ask the question that's on all our minds: Do you think Ewoks are better than Hobbits?

item.title: Giant Bombcast 788: Christian Warp Pipes
item.description: Somehow we got the crew all together at Bakalar's house to chat about desserts, smells, and eventually talk about video games too! AWOOOOOO!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-12-2013
item.description: We're downright feverish in our discussions of Mass Effect 3 DLC, God of War: Ascension, SimCity, Starcraft II: Heart of the Swarm, Thief, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 788: Christian Warp Pipes
item.description: Somehow we got the crew all together at Bakalar's house to chat about desserts, smells, and eventually talk about video games too! AWOOOOOO!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 787: Brother Krillin
item.description: We got a packed house this week as Tam and Lucy joins us to chat about GameSpot's new shows dropping! We also get into Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, Jan's growing problem in Honaki: Star Rail, the bummer that is Redfall, and even more!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 03/08/2013
item.description: Dokuro, Virtue’s Last Reward, PSO2, more Dark Souls, a little Metal Gear Rising Revengeance, GDC speeches, PS4 announcement aftermath, Miyamoto interviews, possible Shenmue kickstarters, Skullgirls kickstarter, Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate cross-region pla

item.title: Giant Bombcast 787: Brother Krillin
item.description: We got a packed house this week as Tam and Lucy joins us to chat about GameSpot's new shows dropping! We also get into Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, Jan's growing problem in Honaki: Star Rail, the bummer that is Redfall, and even more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-05-2013
item.description: Ryan returns from Disneyland; Jeff and Vinny reinvent bath-time and mealtime; Brad falls down an apocalyptic rabbit hole; everyone has allergies.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 786: Moms Love Zelda
item.description: We're baaaaack with another episode of the Giant Bombcast to chat about Minecraft Legends, Pulseman, our surprise about how much fun Dead Island 2 is, big Epic and Apple updates, and even more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 786: Moms Love Zelda
item.description: We're baaaaack with another episode of the Giant Bombcast to chat about Minecraft Legends, Pulseman, our surprise about how much fun Dead Island 2 is, big Epic and Apple updates, and even more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 785: Tronald Duck
item.description: This week we're joined by our dear friend Alex Boniello as he talks about his forray into "games" with Foul Play, the Mega Man Battle Network Collection, Dead Island 2 being surprisingly fun, the Mario movie inching closer to $1 Billion, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 02/28/2013 - The PlayStation 4
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's back with the first official details on the PlayStation 4.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 785: Tronald Duck
item.description: This week we're joined by our dear friend Alex Boniello as he talks about his forray into "games" with Foul Play, the Mega Man Battle Network Collection, Dead Island 2 being surprisingly fun, the Mario movie inching closer to $1 Billion, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 02/21/2013 - Destiny
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann's back in from Seattle, where he talked to the team at Bungie about their new game, Destiny.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 784: Doctor Chat
item.description: Grubb, Dan, and Jan return from sunny San Diego to console Bakalar on his FOMO. They recount their trip and their time at DreamHack, talk about today's headlines, AND give valuable croissant advice.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 784: Doctor Chat

item.description: We put the Bomb in Bombcast with Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood's paranoid multiplayer, our collective Fable III disappointment, the dilating effect of Pac-Man Championship Edition DX, Drifting 101 in Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 11-30-2010
item.description: We return from the Thanksgiving break ready to discuss milk and Pepsi, Ezio’s posse, expert Foley work, Rosetta Stone-induced panic, Tron, Japanese smooth jazz, Brad’s introduction to drifting, speed stacking, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-07-2010
item.description: Get your meat-eaters license, it's another episode of the Giant Bombcast! This week we put Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood to rest, address annoying save mechanics, catch up with Wesley Snipes, and more. There really are Bombcasts for every occasion!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-14-2010
item.description: We match three with PopCap's own Jeff Green, who joins us for this week's discussions of adult-themed Bejeweled, our Doritos Game of the Year, Andy Serkis' one-man show, inventing ancient artifacts for Uncharted 3, and much more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 12-21-2010
item.description: Hey 2010! Put your head between your legs and kiss your ass goodbye with this all-emails edition of the Giant Bombcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Day One
item.description: We open up our deliberations with 2010's 2009 Game of the Year, Best New Character, Best Original Song, Best Debut, and Best PC-Only Game.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Day Two
item.description: The battle continues with Best Downloadable Add-On, Best Co-Op, Best Download-Only Game, Best-Looking Game, and Best Xbox 360-Only Game.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Day Three
item.description: Who will be the first to snap as we enter day three of our Game of the Year deliberations, which include Most Ridiculous Use of FMV, Most Improved Franchise, Most Egregious Use of Product Placement/In-Game Advertising, Worst Accent, and Best Wii-Only Game

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Day Four
item.description: We pass the point of no return in our deliberations, which today include Character We'd Most Like to Party With, Dave's Eastern Bloc Game of the Year, Worst Trend, Best Story, and Best DS-Only Game.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/15/2012 - Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is back to give you his thoughts on the final version of Activision's latest Call of Duty.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Paul Barnett's Top 10
item.description: EA Mythic's Paul Barnett brings some holiday cheer and his top 10 games of 2010.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Day Five
item.description: Our descent into madness is almost complete as we enter day five of our deliberations, where we choose winners for The Northies - Best Performance by Nolan North, Best Competitive Multiplayer, Best Ending, the Take a Break Award, and Best PS3-Only Game.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Giant Bomb Game of the Year 2010: Day Six
item.description: And lo, the sixth seal was broken, and it revealed our Best Game Room Release, Best Motion-Controlled Game, Worst Game of the Year, Most Disappointing Game, Best Multiplatform Game, and our 2010 Game of the Year!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-04-2011
item.description: Ryan, Vinny, and Brad are joined by a very special flaxen-haired guest in this, our inaugural Bombcast of 2011! We return from our holiday break with heartwarming tales of family togetherness and... actually, it's mostly just games.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-11-2011
item.description: Jeff takes a break from his go-kart training to join our discussions of kill room aesthetics, earthquakes, Predator tech support, Mel Blanc oral reports, Borderlands sadism, ilomilo pronunciation, crank calls, crypto, and 3DS redesigns. Plus, a contest!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-18-2011
item.description: Alex Navarro tags in on this week's conversations about DC Universe Online's shortcomings, whatever “Macho Man” Randy Savage is up to these days, the unexplored qualities of the Charlie Sheen movie The Chase, Final Fantasy XIII-2, and much more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 01-25-2011
item.description: With Ryan planted firmly on the bench, Jeff steps into the role of host and there's nothing you can do to stop him. Nothing! Also, the 3DS and PSP2 are totally discussed in exhaustive detail and/or speculation! Can you possibly afford to miss this?

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02-01-2011
item.description: Despite a compromised immune system, Ryan reclaims his rightful hosting duties, doing his best to keep it focused on Dead Space 2, Bionic Commando: Rearmed 2, the Sony NGP, and MMO pricing structures, and away from Jeff's insane Nintendo agenda. Ningenda?

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02-08-2011
item.description: Our expert team of broadcasters bring you the Super Bowl wrap-up coverage you crave, hitting other hot topics like, Dead Space subtitles, Stanley Kubrick and Terry Gilliam vs. Buckaroo Bonzai, Bionic Commando Rearmed 2, wizards, and more along the way!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/08/2012 - Curiosity
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann is about to injure his fingers due to excessive screen tapping.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02-15-2011
item.description: Jeff and Ryan return from DICE with tales of chest models, Hollywood agents, outer space, and Facebook! We also discuss You Don't Know Jack, Stacking, Killzone 3, Marvel vs. Capcom 3, Duke Nukem Forever, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 02-22-2011
item.description: Vinny punishes himself with 10 more inexplicable hours of Demon's Souls, Jeff tries to buy the publishing rights to RBI Baseball, Brad celebrates American royalty on Presidents Day, Ryan denounces saxophones, and everyone yells on this week's Bombcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-01-2011
item.description: Brad and Jeff went to the Microsoft showcase and have a lot to say about Batman: Arkham City, Gears of War 3, ketchup, and Vinny and Alex are here, too! WARNING: Nintendo downloads are also discussed.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-02-2011 (GDC 2011)
item.description: Jeff and Brad are joined by guests for the first of our two podcasts from Game Developers Conference 2011. Hang out with us as we chat with Adam Sessler, John Pearl, Chris Remo, Patrick Klepek, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-03-2011 (GDC 2011)
item.description: Jeff and Brad lure a fresh batch of guests into the Giant Bomb bar, including Jeremiah Slaczka, Ben Gilbert, John Vignocchi, John Bellomy, John Drake, and more! Listen in to this noisy podcast as we discuss Chicago, Japan, Tron threesomes, and GDC 2011.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-08-2011
item.description: We've got BurgerTime pathos, Shanghai McGee, Suda51's boner, the far-flung future of the Gathering of Juggalos, Beyond Good & Evil HD, spoiler Pokemon, Tiny Iwata, and more! Oh, and Max Schaefer stops by to talk about all things Torchlight. Strap it o

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-15-2011
item.description: The brave few that made it back from the Penny Arcade Expo with any serious longterm damage gather to discuss the games at the show along with our shiny new Nintendo 3DS, Prey 2, and the best way to smith up some rocks.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-22-2011
item.description: The World Champions of Podcasting are back at it again! Get your fill of Dragon Age II, premium Japanese thermoses, Philip K. Dick's insatiable appetite for amphetamines, Crysis 2, our first week with the Nintendo 3DS, and much more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 03-29-2011
item.description: It's your boy, the big dog pitbull, dropping' bombs on 'em with Zojirushi action journals, Dragon Age II economics, the 3DS launch, Pac-Man Battle Royale, Fight for Relief, Resident Evil, Duke Nukem delays, and more! Yo, rewind that!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-05-2011
item.description: Brad returns from his self-imposed exile, and we dazzle him--Rip-Van-Winkle-style--with tales of Mega Man Universe, the cancellation of The Agency, the rise and fall and re-rise of Majesco, GameStop going digital, Stardock confusion, and much more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/01/2012 - Need for Speed: Most Wanted
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann takes a break from smashing through billboards and gates to talk to you about Need for Speed: Most Wanted.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-11-2011
item.description: Jeff, Vinny, and Dave take to the microphones to discuss the stupidity of kayaking, Capcom's recent announcements, that Persona 4 anime, and more.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-19-2011
item.description: We get messy with Grandma's Cookies as the conversation leans towards less tawdry fare, like Might & Magic: Clash of Heroes, Bethesda's open-world first-person shooter factory, vendor trash, Wii HD, and--surprise surprise--Mortal Kombat and Portal 2.

item.title: Giant Bombcast Portal 2 Spoilercast!
item.description: Ryan Davis sits down with Valve's Erik Wolpaw, Jay Pinkerton, and Chet Faliszek to discuss the inner workings of Portal 2. WARNING! Do not listen if you haven't finished Portal 2 yet. You will ruin Portal 2 for yourself.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 04-26-2011
item.description: Brad returns from Mexico with magical tales of free pool bars, Ryan dares Vinny to stop playing Dragon Age II, and Patrick helps us digest what has been an action-packed week in news in this week's edition of the Giant Bombcast!

item.title: Game Mess Mornings 01/27/23
item.description: Jeff Grubb is joined by Tamoor Hussain to discuss the new Far Cry in development, a possible Nintendo Direct, and more video game news that you can use!

item.title: Voicemail Dump Truck 54
item.description: We're joined by our dear friend Abby Russell to discuss hot topics like soups and shellfish!

item.title: Game Mess Mornings 01/26/23
item.description: Jeff Grubb is joined by Jan Ochoa to talk about the Xbox Developer direct and MORE!

item.title: Game Mess Mornings 01/25/23
item.description: Jeff Grubb is joined by Lucy James to talk about GoldenEye, Destiny 2 Servers, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 773: Weird Jesus Vibes
item.description: The crew is back to talk about how Forspoken nails the New York experience, Fire Emblem Engage, the new Dual Sense Edge controller, Marvel's Avengers shutting down, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/25/2012 - "Old" Hardware & Price Cuts
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann lays out a couple of the deals you might find on console hardware this holiday season.

item.title: Game Mess Mornings 01/23/23
item.description: Jeff Grubb is joined by Kahlief Adams from SpawnOnMe to discuss 343's future, Armored Core 6, Forspoken reviews, and the final update for Marvel's Avengers.

item.title: Game Mess Mornings 01/20/23
item.description: Jeff Grubb is joined by Ben Hanson of MinnMax to discuss the future of Halo, Ubisoft's planned releases, and even more Nintendo Switches?

item.title: Game Mess Mornings 01/19/23
item.description: Grubb is joined by Jan Ochoa to discuss the woes at Microsoft and Ubisoft, Returnal coming to PC, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-03-2011
item.description: We re-open old Fable III wounds, get serious about Mortal Kombat fiction, spend an inordinate amount of time figuring out how to bring pizza to space, try and make sense of Jet's publishing/foreign language business, and more in this week's Bombcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-10-2011
item.description: We build a scatological birdhouse in this week's Bombcast, discussing Lorne Michaels' royalties, Sony's E3 press conference, the burden of fruit trees, the controversial popcorn issue, foot food, and, of course, lobthtuh monthtuth.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-17-2011
item.description: It's brown apples for everyone as we discuss the finer points of mustaches, sailboat brunches, the rich tradition of running through the park drunk and naked, and more. We also spend way, way too much time discussing Rockstar's latest, L.A. Noire.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-24-2011
item.description: Brad messes around with his Windows Phone 7 phone, Jeff waxes rhapsodic about BioShock Infinite, Vinny buries himself in Witcher backlog, Ryan goes to a parade, and everyone stresses hard on E3 in this week's Bombcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast Pre-E3 2011 Edition
item.description: Special guest Michael "Pach-Man" Pachter joins Ryan, Jeff, and Patrick for this pre-E3 Bombcast full of predictions, hopes, fears, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-31-2011
item.description: It's our last regularly scheduled Bombcast before the crew ships off to Los Angeles for E3! We cover men's haircuts, L.A. Noire, Call of Duty Elite, StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm, PlayStation Vita, and, of course, E3.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2011 Day Zero
item.description: We welcome several special guests--including Braid creator Jonathan Blow, e & Stepto from Xbox, and Gary Whitta--while also covering the Microsoft, EA, Ubisoft, and Sony press conferences.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/18/2012 - Forza Horizon
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann spins some doughnuts, beats a speed trap time, and races through this quick talk about Microsoft's new racing game.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2011 Day One
item.description: Mega64. Naughty Dog. Double Fine. David Jaffe. Rich Gallup. Four hours and twenty four minutes of the rawest, realest developer conversation you will ever hear.

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2011 Day Two
item.description: By jove! What an extraordinarily long podcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast E3 2011 Day Three
item.description: No one man should have all this podcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-14-2011
item.description: As if you didn't get enough Giant Bomb podcasting action last week, this week our E3 2011 PTSD is compounded by the release of Duke Nukem Forever, which, it turns out, is an actual game. Sorta. You know what? You should probably just listen.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-21-2011
item.description: The steamiest podcast heats up just in time for summer as we jam on inFamous 2, Origin.com, bad milk and worse steaks, Trenched, fake rumors about blood ninjas, Ocarina of Time, Wii U, stealing Redboxes, and more...girl.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 06-28-2011
item.description: We celebrate a special birthday with a 100-foot lava man, wizard beef, controversial pie, the world's worst lapdance, Swery, and everyone's favorite, the United States Supreme Court. It's a party, y'all!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-05-2011
item.description: The boys recuperate from an amnesia-inducing holiday weekend with Puzzle Agent 2, Galaga Legions DX, thatgamecompany's Journey, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-12-2011
item.description: Patrick tells the tale of his first California Extreme, Jeff hates Applebee's, Vinny gets disturbed by American McGee, Brad gets carried in Starcraft, and Ryan's a goddamn narc.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-19-2011
item.description: Ryan reinvents the remix as we discuss Doom 3, Garcia Hotspur's Pepsi endorsement, socks and pillows, public pools and gas station bathrooms, and, of course, Bastion.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-26-2011
item.description: Email chaos continues to infect the Giant Bombcast as we try and discuss Vinny's tortilla-craft, Jeff's dysfunctional relationship with Catherine, Brad's affection for Starfox's vocal stylings, the fate of Mega Man, From Dust, Demolition Man, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/11/2012 - XCOM: Enemy Unknown
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann waits his turn to pop out of cover and shoot your alien face in its FACE.

item.description: We blow your shirt clean off your back with over two-and-a-half hours of alcohol-fueled, nitro-burnin' funny podcast action! Scantron standardized tests! From Dust! Secret Caravella Podcasts! Insanely Twisted Shadow Planet! AND MORE!!!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-09-2011
item.description: It’s natural 20s for everyone as Patrick and Ryan testify about their time with The Witness, Vinny continues to be bewitched by The Witcher, and Brad gets physical with fruit. We also discuss the Borderlands 2 kerfuffle, Pandaren Brewmasters, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-16-2011
item.description: Jeff returns from his exile of silence to weigh in on the Summer of Disappointment, Patrick scratches an itch, Brad goes free-to-play, and Ryan catches the MOBA bug, plus Steam trading, Creative Suite: Global Offensive, and more in this week’s Bombcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-30-2011

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 11/09/2017 - Need for Speed Payback
item.description: EA's long-running driving game franchise took last year off. Did the time off result in a better game? Jeff Gerstmann is here to say no. No, it did not.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 10/31/2014 -- "Ventures in Dreamland"
item.description: The Evil Within, Monster Strike, Terra Battle, Fantasy Life, Pokemon Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire, Japanese strategy guides, retro game shopping, Nintendo earnings, QOL devices, Bloodborne 30fps-gate, Dominos Pizza, Valkyria Chronicles, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/30/2014 - Xbox One Price Cut
item.description: Microsoft is shedding $50 for the holidays. Jeff Gerstmann has some details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/23/2014 - Killer Instinct Season 2
item.description: TJ Combo, Maya, and six more characters are coming to Microsoft's free-to-play fighting game and Jeff Gerstmann is here with some details.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-18-2009
item.description: Since we're not allowed into Germany for reasons we'd rather not discuss, we stay home and chat about Shadow Complex, the strategery of Brütal Legend's multiplayer, the Wolfenstein timeline, Brad's exciting QuakeCon trip, Limerick Island, and much more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/28/2014 (Premium)
item.description: We're fresh (?!) off of Extra Life to recap strategies for stayin' up all night, Drew's globetrotting adventures, more on Sunset Overdrive, the not-very-mysterious identity of Quartermann, Xbox price drops, and the gastric processes of vampires.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/28/2014
item.description: We're fresh (?!) off of Extra Life to recap strategies for stayin' up all night, Drew's globetrotting adventures, more on Sunset Overdrive, the not-very-mysterious identity of Quartermann, Xbox price drops, and the gastric processes of vampires.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Cara Ellison: 10/27/2014
item.description: With Giant Bomb's Extra Life marathons coming to an end, Cara Ellison joins us from Japan to kick off a week that probably won't feature as many 24-hour marathons.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Cara Ellison: 10/27/2014
item.description: With Giant Bomb's Extra Life marathons coming to an end, Cara Ellison joins us from Japan to kick off a week that probably won't feature as many 24-hour marathons.

item.description: With Drew wrapping up his odyssey on the other side of the world, Jason's back to keep the podcast party going with more on Bayonetta 2, Sunset Overdrive, Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel, Killer Instinct Season 2, Axl Rose's favorite pinball phrases, some byg

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/21/2014
item.description: With Drew wrapping up his odyssey on the other side of the world, Jason's back to keep the podcast party going with more on Bayonetta 2, Sunset Overdrive, Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel, Killer Instinct Season 2, Axl Rose's favorite pinball phrases, some byg

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 10/20/2014
item.description: My initial impressions of Shinji Mikami's latest, the advantages of burner phones, and answers to burning questions like "tacos or nachos?"

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-11-2009
item.description: This week we welcome arcade enthusiast and friend of Giant Bomb Jared Rea to the table for conversation about EVO cliques, Korean rhythm games, Guitar Hero 5, Spielberg's Halo, 50 Cent in Modern Warfare 2, Michael Cera in everything, and more!

item.title: 8-4 Play: 10/17/2014 -- "Terra-ble"
item.description: New Nintendo 3DS, Castlevania: Bloodlines, Danganronpa, Vib-Ribbon, Terra Battle, Alien: Isolation, Destiny, Japanese Sales, NPDs, Ex-Irrational Kickstarters, and more!

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/16/2014 - Bayonetta 2
item.description: PlatinumGames is preparing to unleash another wild dose of Bayonetta onto the unsuspecting public, and Jeff Gerstmann has the details.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/15/2014 - Alien: Isolation
item.description: A game that's actually true to the original fiction of Alien? That's gotta be impossible. Jeff Gerstmann checks in with details from our review.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 10/02/2014 - Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor
item.description: A Lord of the Rings game that even people who can't stand Lord of the Rings can appreciate? Jeff Gerstmann checks in.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 09/25/2014 - Blizzard Kills Titan
item.description: Blizzard has revealed new details about its "Titan" project, and Dan Ryckert is here with the details.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 10/14/2014
item.description: With the Destiny raid completed, we sit back and, um, chat about the Destiny raid... Wait, come back! Jason A. Striker joins us to talk Bayonetta 2, The Evil Within, Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel, the new New 3DS, more on AC: Unity resolutions, nice bounty

item.title: Alt+F1: 28 - 10/13/2014 - Enter The DRS Lang-Zone
item.description: It's been quite the fortnight in the world of speedy race cars. So what better time to invite Giant Bomb Chicago's Dave Lang on to talk about attending races, biz-dev, Bernie's breakfast and Sochi for about five minutes.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 10/13/2014
item.description: We curse how badly Microsoft has bungled D4, wonder how QTE final boss fights exist in 2014, explain how yet another developer was chased out of their home this weekend, and answer your questions.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 10/10/2014
item.description: Alex makes NBA 2K15 sound like a nightmarish land barely full of basketball, I've become quite fond of plant collecting in Middle-Earth, and we run down the week's news.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 10/10/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Alex makes NBA 2K15 sound like a nightmarish land barely full of basketball, I've become quite fond of plant collecting in Middle-Earth, and we run down the week's news.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 08-04-2009
item.description: This week's Bombcast covers the life and death of The Matrix Online, the storied history of Sierra On-Line, the games that Gearbox is (and isn't) making, the psychology of holiday game releases, swords, and other pressing topics of the utmost importance!

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: From the Ashes of Darksiders Comes Airship Syndicate
item.description: Two co-founders of Vigil Games, including artist Joe Madureira, are starting from square one with a new studio.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: Ex-Irrational Developers Slip on The Black Glove
item.description: Joe Fielder, formerly of both Irrational and GameSpot, joins me to discuss the weird and wild new game from a group of BioShock veterans.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Samantha Kalman: 10/06/2014
item.description: The designer of Sentris joins us, as we discuss the risks and rewards of early access, show our love for Shadow(s) of Mordor, and ask the Internet to develop a recipe for positivity gravity.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 10/03/2014
item.description: Many nights of sleep were sacrificed to bring you these Alien: Isolation impressions. Alex talks about Shadow of Mordor, I guess.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 10/03/2014 -- "Super Smashed Bros."
item.description: Shadow of Mordor, Super Smash Bros. for 3DS, Final Fantasy 14, Destiny, Terra Battle, Super Smash Bros. parity problems, Media Create numbers, Nomura's burning rage, Call of Duty in decline, and more!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/30/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Quarter four is upon us and it's all games all the time around here, with in-depth chattin' about Shadow of Mordor, Forza Horizon 2, Super Smash Bros. 3DS, and Gauntlet. Well, fine, you can also hang around for our favorite hangover avoidance strategies.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/30/2014

item.title: Alt+F1: 27 - 09/30/2014 - Turn B1-66ER
item.description: Why can't other racetracks name their corners after mechs and keytars? Tune in for these pressing issues and more along with Verstappen's day out, three-car teams, Maldonado's shining moment, and where, precisely, to acquire Buckfast.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-28-2009
item.description: Brad returns from the glorious Carolinas for discussions of bo-rounds, 'Splosion Man, the correct pronunciation of Sidhe, King of Fighters XII, San Diego Comic-Con, Microsoft's Halo plans, candy bars, PAX 09, and other nonsense!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Alexa Ray Corriea: 09/29/2014
item.description: We recruit Polygon's resident Lord of the Rings overlord to talk all things Tolkien, gush over D4, and generate Destiny conspiracy theories.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/26/2014
item.description: Alex shares what he's played of Civilization: Beyond Earth, I lament how few people remember Rockstar's skateboarding game, and we talk through the week's news.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/26/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Alex shares what he's played of Civilization: Beyond Earth, I lament how few people remember Rockstar's skateboarding game, and we talk through the week's news.

item.title: The Powerbombcast Episode 12: The White Castle of Fear
item.description: In this unusually brisk episode, the King of Trios team of Alex, Dan, and Giancarlo take on Night of Champions, NXT's unbelievable talent pool, the Bay Area's finest local wrestling, and the legacies of Eric Bischoff and Goldberg.

item.title: Alt+F1: 26 - 09/23/2014 - Singapore Sabotage
item.description: The lights are down in Singapore, but before we watch Apollo 13 starring Nico Rosberg, we run by the concession stand and grab some hot water, explosive wings, and a pair of Maldonado Specials.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/23/2014 (Premium)
item.description: It's an Irish invasion as GameSpot's Danny O'Dwyer joins us to talk about the right way to enjoy Destiny, the wrong way to parse English accents, whatever the hell Final Fantasy is now, and the perils of programming video games. It has been two (2) weeks

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/22/2014
item.description: Alex wrestles with his feelings about Swery's new game, Patrick tells poop stories about Danganronpa 2, and we answer your questions.

item.title: 8-4 Play: 09/19/2014 -- "Tokyo Game Show 2014"
item.description: Join us for our 5th annual Tokyo Game Show free-for-all, with guests from Polygon, Game Informer, SCEA, 17-Bit and more on-hand to talk Bloodborne, FF15, Bravely Second, FF Explorers, The Evil Within, RE Revelations 2, Silent Hills, DQ Heroes, Mighty No.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/19/2014 (Premium)
item.description: We try to wrestle with being interested in the next Final Fantasy, speculate about Swery's new game, and talk through the rest of this week's TGS news.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-21-2009
item.description: We recover from Friday night's funcaholism in tonight's episode of Everybody Loves Bombcast with Wii Sports Resort, Evo 2009, the correct pronunciation of Karateka, toast guns, Shadow Complex, night vision goggles, Rock Band Network, and more!

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/19/2014
item.description: We try to wrestle with being interested in the next Final Fantasy, speculate about Swery's new game, and talk through the rest of this week's TGS news.

item.title: Giant Bomb Presents: The Group Who Conquered Destiny's First Raid
item.description: It took more than 10 hours and 1,000 deaths for Primeguard to take down Bungie's Vault of Glass challenge. Here's how they did it.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 09/16/2014 (Premium)
item.description: Destiny still rules the video game talk around these parts... but then, who just listens to this podcast for games? Especially when you can also hear about hot topics like dying on Mars, drinking on battleships, the John Carmack Tweet of the Week, and TWO

item.title: Alt+F1: 25 - 09/16/2014 - Formula E Fireworks
item.description: The XFL of racing gets off to a wild start with generational rivalries, hot swapping, and techno music. Meanwhile, back in Stuffy Racing for Old People, everybody's still arguing about the spirit of radio.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/15/2014
item.description: Alex discloses his new obsession with Desert Golfing, we consider the future of Destiny and Minecraft, and spend a while answering your questions.

item.title: Bombin' the A.M. With Scoops and the Wolf: 09/12/2014
item.description: We try to wrap our heads around Destiny, NHL 15, and Hack 'n Slash before spoiling The Walking Dead's second season. Don't worry, there's a big heads up.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 09/11/2014 - Destiny
item.description: Jeff Gerstmann checks in from planet Venus with a report on how Bungie's latest is treating him thus far.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 09/04/2014 - Lethal League
item.description: Pong and fighting games haven't crossed paths since Pong Kombat, but Lethal League is here to change all that. Jeff Gerstmann is here to talk about the new four-player version of the game.

item.title: Gaming Minute: Giant Bomb Gaming Minute 08/28/2014 - Infamous: First Light
item.description: Combat arenas? Jeff Gerstmann's here to talk about some of the missteps in this "standalone expansion" to Infamous: Second Son.

item.title: Giant Bombcast 07-14-2009
item.description: We cover the infinite beards of California Extreme, the wrong way to move into a new apartment, UFC vs. EA, and the glorious returns of Monkey Island, MechWarrior, and Command & Conquer in this week's edition of the Giant Bombcast!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 05-06-2008
item.description: We hit the redline with the latest from Sony, a treatise on Card Sharks, free Rock Band songs, modular solutions for virtual modern living, the future of X-COM, Dr. Dre Kart Racing, and plenty of GTA4. That’s how you play the game!

item.title: Giant Bombcast 698: Up In My Frunk
item.description: This week we get into the Back 4 Blood Beta, finally queue up in Splitgate, talk about skins and cosmetics, and of course get into front trunk discourse.
